Dissociative disorders has Symptom: Severe stress or problems in relationships, work or other important areas of life.
Dissociative disorders has Symptom: Not being able to cope well with emotional or work-related stress.
Dissociative disorders has Symptom: Memory loss, also called amnesia, of certain time periods, events, people and personal information.
Dissociative disorders has Symptom: Mental health problems, such as depression, anxiety, and suicidal thoughts and behaviors.

Dissociative disorders has Cause: Dissociative disorders usually start as a way to cope with shocking, distressing or painful events. The disorders most often form in children who go through long-term physical, sexual or emotional abuse. Less often, the disorders form in children who've lived in a home where they went through frightening times or they never knew what to expect. The stress of war or natural disasters also can bring on dissociative disorders.
Dissociative disorders has Risk Factor: You're at greatest risk of having a dissociative disorder if you've had long-term physical, sexual or emotional abuse during childhood.
Dissociative disorders has Complication: Depression and anxiety.
Dissociative disorders has Complication: Post-traumatic stress disorder.
Dissociative disorders has Complication: Sleep disorders, including nightmares, insomnia and sleepwalking.
Dissociative disorders has Complication: Physical symptoms such as lightheadedness or seizures that are not due to epilepsy.
Dissociative disorders has Complication: Eating disorders.
Dissociative disorders has Complication: Problems with sexual function.
Dissociative disorders has Complication: Problems with alcohol and drug use.
Dissociative disorders has Complication: Personality disorders.
Dissociative disorders has Complication: Major problems in personal relationships, at school and at work.
Dissociative disorders has Complication: Self-injury or high-risk behavior.
Dissociative disorders has Complication: Suicidal thoughts and behavior.
Dissociative disorders has Preventio: Talk to a trusted person such as a friend, your health care professional or a leader in your faith community.
Dissociative disorders has Preventio: Ask for help finding resources such as parenting support groups and family therapists.

Dissociative disorders has Preventio: Look for churches, other faith-based groups and community education programs that offer parenting classes that also may help you learn a healthier parenting style.
Diverticulitis has Symptom: Nausea.
Diverticulitis has Symptom: Fever.
Diverticulitis has Symptom: Tenderness in the abdomen when touched.
Diverticulitis has Symptom: Changes in stool, including sudden diarrhea or constipation.

Diverticulitis has Cause: Diverticula gradually develop over time in the walls of the colon. They are common in older adults. Pressure in the colon — possibly from spasms or straining — may cause diverticula to form where the wall of the colon is weak.
Diverticulitis has Risk Factor: Obesity.
Diverticulitis has Risk Factor: Smoking.
Diverticulitis has Risk Factor: A diet of low-fiber foods.
Diverticulitis has Risk Factor: A diet high in red meat.
Diverticulitis has Risk Factor: Heavy alcohol use.
Diverticulitis has Risk Factor: Lack of exercise.
Diverticulitis has Risk Factor: Low vitamin D levels.

Diverticulitis has Risk Factor: Certain medicines, such as steroids, opioids and nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), such as ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin IB, others) and naproxen sodium (Aleve).
Diverticulitis has Complication: A pocket of pus from bacterial disease, called an abscess.
Diverticulitis has Complication: Blockage of the colon.
Diverticulitis has Complication: An irregular passageway, called a fistula, between the bowel and another organ in the body.
Diverticulitis has Complication: A tear in the colon wall that allows waste to spill out, causing serious disease of the abdomen lining, called peritonitis.
Diverticulitis has Complication: Bleeding from ruptured blood vessels, also called diverticular hemorrhage.
Diverticulitis has Preventio: Exercise regularly.
Diverticulitis has Preventio: Eat a high-fiber diet.
Diverticulitis has Preventio: Maintain a healthy weight.
Diverticulitis has Preventio: Drink plenty of fluids.
Diverticulitis has Preventio: Quit smoking and limit alcohol use.
Dizziness has Symptom: A sense of motion or spinning, also called vertigo.
Dizziness has Symptom: Lightheadedness or feeling faint.
Dizziness has Symptom: A loss of balance or the sense of not feeling steady.
Dizziness has Symptom: A feeling of floating, wooziness or heavy-headedness.

Dizziness has Cause: Dizziness has many possible causes. These include conditions that affect the inner ear, motion sickness and medicine side effects. Very rarely, dizziness may be caused by a condition such as poor circulation, infection or injury.

Dizziness has Risk Factor: Older adults are more likely to have health conditions that cause dizziness, especially a sense of less balance. They're also more likely to take medicines that can cause dizziness.
Dizziness has Risk Factor: A past bout of dizziness.

Dizziness has Complication: Dizziness can lead to other health concerns called complications. For instance, it can raise your risk of falling and hurting yourself. Getting dizzy while driving a car or running heavy machinery can make an accident more likely. You also may have long-term complications if you don't get treatment for a health condition that may be causing your dizziness.

Double uterus has Symptom: A double uterus often causes no symptoms. The condition may be discovered during a regular pelvic exam. Or it may be found during imaging tests to find the cause of repeated miscarriages.
Double uterus has Cause: Health experts don't know exactly why some fetuses develop a double uterus. Genetics may play a role. That's because this rare condition sometimes runs in families.

Double uterus has Risk Factor: The risk factors for a double uterus are not well understood. The cause of the condition isn't known either. Genetics likely plays a role, along with other unknown factors.
Double uterus has Complication: Infertility.
Double uterus has Complication: Miscarriage.
Double uterus has Complication: Premature birth.
Double uterus has Complication: Kidney problems.
Down syndrome has Symptom: Flattened face and small nose with a flat bridge.
Down syndrome has Symptom: Small head.
Down syndrome has Symptom: Short neck.
Down syndrome has Symptom: Tongue that tends to stick out of the mouth.
Down syndrome has Symptom: Upward slanting eyelids.
Down syndrome has Symptom: Skin fold of the upper eyelid that covers the inner corner of the eye.
Down syndrome has Symptom: Small, rounded ears.
Down syndrome has Symptom: Wide, small hands with a single crease in the palm and short fingers.
Down syndrome has Symptom: Small feet with a space between the first and second toes.
Down syndrome has Symptom: Tiny white spots on the colored part of the eye called the iris. These white spots are called Brushfield's spots.
Down syndrome has Symptom: Short height.
Down syndrome has Symptom: Poor muscle tone in infancy.
Down syndrome has Symptom: Joints that are loose and too flexible.
Down syndrome has Cause: Trisomy 21.
Down syndrome has Cause: Mosaic Down syndrome.
Down syndrome has Cause: Translocation Down syndrome.

Down syndrome has Risk Factor: Chances of giving birth to a child with Down syndrome goes up with age because older eggs have a greater risk of unusual chromosome division. The risk of having a child with Down syndrome increases after a pregnant person is 35 years of age. But most children with Down syndrome are born to pregnant people under age 35 because they have far more babies.
Down syndrome has Risk Factor: Being carriers of the genetic translocation for Down syndrome.
Down syndrome has Risk Factor: Having had one child with Down syndrome.
Down syndrome has Complication: Heart problems.
Down syndrome has Complication: Problems with the digestive system and digesting food.
Down syndrome has Complication: Problems with the immune system.
Down syndrome has Complication: Sleep apnea.
Down syndrome has Complication: Being overweight.
Down syndrome has Complication: Spinal problems.
Down syndrome has Complication: Leukemia.
Down syndrome has Complication: Alzheimer's disease.
Down syndrome has Complication: Other problems.

Down syndrome has Preventio: There's no way to prevent Down syndrome. If you're at higher risk of having a child with Down syndrome or you already have one child with Down syndrome, you may want to talk with a genetic counselor before becoming pregnant.
Dressler syndrome has Symptom: Chest pain, which may get worse with deep breaths.
Dressler syndrome has Symptom: Fever.
Dressler syndrome has Symptom: Shortness of breath.

Dressler syndrome has Cause: Experts think Dressler syndrome is caused by the immune system's response to heart damage. The body reacts to the injured tissue by sending immune cells and proteins called antibodies to clean up and repair the affected area. Sometimes this response causes swelling due to the inflammation in the sac around the heart that's known as the pericardium.
Dressler syndrome has Risk Factor: Chest injury.
Dressler syndrome has Risk Factor: Some types of heart surgery.
Dressler syndrome has Risk Factor: Heart attack.
Dressler syndrome has Complication: Cardiac tamponade.
Dressler syndrome has Complication: Constrictive pericarditis.
Dressler syndrome has Preventio: Some studies suggest that taking the anti-inflammatory medicine colchicine (Colcrys, Gloperba, others) soon after heart surgery may help prevent Dressler syndrome.
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Symptom: Feeling that you have to use the drug regularly — daily or even several times a day
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Symptom: Having intense urges for the drug that block out any other thoughts
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Symptom: Over time, needing more of the drug to get the same effect
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Symptom: Taking larger amounts of the drug over a longer period of time than you intended
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Symptom: Making certain that you maintain a supply of the drug
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Symptom: Spending money on the drug, even though you can't afford it
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Symptom: Not meeting obligations and work responsibilities, or cutting back on social or recreational activities because of drug use
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Symptom: Continuing to use the drug, even though you know it's causing problems in your life or causing you physical or psychological harm
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Symptom: Doing things to get the drug that you normally wouldn't do, such as stealing
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Symptom: Driving or doing other risky activities when you're under the influence of the drug
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Symptom: Spending a good deal of time getting the drug, using the drug or recovering from the effects of the drug
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Symptom: Failing in your attempts to stop using the drug
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Symptom: Experiencing withdrawal symptoms when you attempt to stop taking the drug
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Cause: Environment.
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Cause: Genetics.
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Risk Factor: Family history of addiction.
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Risk Factor: Mental health disorder.
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Risk Factor: Peer pressure.
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Risk Factor: Lack of family involvement.
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Risk Factor: Early use.
Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Risk Factor: Taking a highly addictive drug.

Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Complication: Methamphetamine, opiates and cocaine are highly addictive and cause multiple short-term and long-term health consequences, including psychotic behavior, seizures or death due to overdose. Opioid drugs affect the part of the brain that controls breathing, and overdose can result in death. Taking opioids with alcohol increases this risk.

Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Complication: GHBand flunitrazepam may cause sedation, confusion and memory loss. These so-called "date rape drugs" are known to impair the ability to resist unwanted contact and recollection of the event. At high doses, they can cause seizures, coma and death. The danger increases when these drugs are taken with alcohol.

Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Complication: MDMA— also known as molly or ecstasy — can interfere with the body's ability to regulate temperature. A severe spike in body temperature can result in liver, kidney or heart failure and death. Other complications can include severe dehydration, leading to seizures. Long-term,MDMAcan damage the brain.

Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Complication: One particular danger of club drugs is that the liquid, pill or powder forms of these drugs available on the street often contain unknown substances that can be harmful, including other illegally manufactured or pharmaceutical drugs.

Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Complication: Due to the toxic nature of inhalants, users may develop brain damage of different levels of severity. Sudden death can occur even after a single exposure.

Drug addiction (substance use disorder) has Preventio: The best way to prevent an addiction to a drug is not to take the drug at all. If your health care provider prescribes a drug with the potential for addiction, use care when taking the drug and follow instructions.
Drug allergy has Symptom: Skin rash.
Drug allergy has Symptom: Hives.
Drug allergy has Symptom: Itching.
Drug allergy has Symptom: Fever.
Drug allergy has Symptom: Swelling.
Drug allergy has Symptom: Shortness of breath.
Drug allergy has Symptom: Wheezing.
Drug allergy has Symptom: Runny nose.
Drug allergy has Symptom: Itchy, watery eyes.

Drug allergy has Cause: A drug allergy happens when the immune system mistakenly identifies a medicine as a harmful substance, such as a virus or bacterium. Once the immune system detects a medicine as a harmful substance, it develops an antibody specific to that medicine. This can happen the first time you take a medicine, but sometimes an allergy doesn't develop until there have been repeated exposures.
Drug allergy has Risk Factor: A history of other allergies, such as a food allergy or hay fever.
Drug allergy has Risk Factor: A personal or family history of drug allergy.
Drug allergy has Risk Factor: Increased exposure to a medicine because of high doses, repeated use or prolonged use.
Drug allergy has Risk Factor: Certain infections commonly associated with allergic drug reactions, such as HIV infection or Epstein-Barr virus infection.
Drug allergy has Preventio: Inform healthcare professionals.
Drug allergy has Preventio: Wear a bracelet.
Dry eyes has Symptom: Signs and symptoms, which usually affect both eyes, may include:

Dry eyes has Cause: Dry eyes are caused by a variety of reasons that disrupt the healthy tear film. Your tear film has three layers: fatty oils, aqueous fluid and mucus. This combination usually keeps the surface of your eyes lubricated, smooth and clear. Problems with any of these layers can cause dry eyes.
Dry eyes has Risk Factor: Factors that make it more likely that you'll experience dry eyes include:
Dry eyes has Complication: People who have dry eyes may experience these complications:

Dry eyes has Preventio: If you experience dry eyes, pay attention to the situations that are most likely to cause your symptoms. Then find ways to avoid those situations in order to prevent your dry eyes symptoms. For instance:
Dry macular degeneration has Symptom: Visual distortions, such as straight lines seeming bent.
Dry macular degeneration has Symptom: Reduced central vision in one or both eyes.
Dry macular degeneration has Symptom: The need for brighter light when reading or doing close-up work.
Dry macular degeneration has Symptom: Increased difficulty adapting to low light levels, such as when entering a dimly lit restaurant or theater.
Dry macular degeneration has Symptom: Increased blurriness of printed words.
Dry macular degeneration has Symptom: Difficulty recognizing faces.
Dry macular degeneration has Symptom: A well-defined blurry spot or blind spot in the field of vision.

Dry macular degeneration has Cause: No one knows exactly what causes dry macular degeneration. Research suggests that it may be a combination of genes and other factors, including smoking, obesity and diet.
Dry macular degeneration has Risk Factor: This disease is most common in people over 50.
Dry macular degeneration has Risk Factor: Family history and genetics.
Dry macular degeneration has Risk Factor: Race.
Dry macular degeneration has Risk Factor: Smoking.
Dry macular degeneration has Risk Factor: Obesity.
Dry macular degeneration has Risk Factor: Cardiovascular disease.

Dry macular degeneration has Complication: People whose dry macular degeneration has progressed to central vision loss have a higher risk of depression and social isolation. With profound loss of vision, people may see visual hallucinations. This condition is called Charles Bonnet syndrome. Dry macular degeneration may progress to wet macular degeneration, which can quickly cause complete vision loss if left untreated.
Dry macular degeneration has Preventio: Manage all medical conditions.
Dry macular degeneration has Preventio: Don't smoke.
Dry macular degeneration has Preventio: Maintain a healthy weight and exercise regularly.
Dry macular degeneration has Preventio: Choose a diet rich in fruits and vegetables.
Dry macular degeneration has Preventio: Include fish in your diet.
Dry mouth has Symptom: Dryness or a feeling of stickiness in your mouth.
Dry mouth has Symptom: Saliva that seems thick and stringy.
Dry mouth has Symptom: Bad breath.
Dry mouth has Symptom: Having a hard time chewing, speaking and swallowing.
Dry mouth has Symptom: Dry or sore throat and hoarseness.
Dry mouth has Symptom: Dry or grooved tongue.
Dry mouth has Symptom: A changed sense of taste.
Dry mouth has Symptom: Problems wearing dentures.
Dry mouth has Symptom: Lipstick stuck to teeth.
Dry mouth has Cause: Medicines.
Dry mouth has Cause: Aging.
Dry mouth has Cause: Cancer therapy.
Dry mouth has Cause: Nerve damage.
Dry mouth has Cause: Other health conditions.
Dry mouth has Cause: Snoring and mouth breathing.
Dry mouth has Cause: Tobacco and alcohol use.
Dry mouth has Cause: Use of legal or illegal drugs that may be sold on the streets.
Dry mouth has Risk Factor: Take medicines that have dry mouth listed as a possible side effect.
Dry mouth has Risk Factor: Are being treated for cancer.
Dry mouth has Risk Factor: Have nerve damage in the head and neck area.
Dry mouth has Risk Factor: Have other health conditions, such as diabetes, stroke, Alzheimer's disease, Sjogren syndrome orHIV/AIDS.
Dry mouth has Risk Factor: Use tobacco products.
Dry mouth has Risk Factor: Drink alcohol.
Dry mouth has Risk Factor: Use street drugs.
Dry mouth has Risk Factor: Eat sugary or acidic foods or candies.
Dry mouth has Complication: Increased plaque, tooth decay and gum disease.
Dry mouth has Complication: Mouth sores.
Dry mouth has Complication: A yeast infection in the mouth, also known as thrush.
Dry mouth has Complication: Sores or split skin at the corners of the mouth, or cracked lips.
Dry mouth has Complication: Poor nutrition from having problems with chewing and swallowing.
Dry skin has Symptom: A feeling of skin tightness
Dry skin has Symptom: Skin that feels and looks rough
Dry skin has Symptom: Itchiness (pruritus)
Dry skin has Symptom: Slight to severe flaking skin, which causes the ashy look that can affect dry brown and black skin
Dry skin has Symptom: Slight to severe scaling or peeling
Dry skin has Symptom: Cracked "dry riverbed" look to leg
Dry skin has Symptom: Fine lines or cracks
Dry skin has Symptom: Skin that ranges from reddish on white skin to grayish on brown and black skin
Dry skin has Symptom: Deep cracks that may bleed
Dry skin has Cause: Heat.
Dry skin has Cause: Environment.
Dry skin has Cause: Too much bathing or scrubbing.
Dry skin has Cause: Harsh soaps and detergents.
Dry skin has Cause: Other skin conditions.
Dry skin has Cause: Medical treatments.
Dry skin has Cause: Aging.
Dry skin has Risk Factor: Are over 40, as the skin's ability to retain moisture diminishes with age
Dry skin has Risk Factor: Live in cold, windy conditions or low-humidity climates
Dry skin has Risk Factor: Have a job that requires you to immerse your hands in water, such as nursing or hairstyling
Dry skin has Risk Factor: Use your hands to work with cement, clay or soil
Dry skin has Risk Factor: Swim frequently in chlorinated pools
Dry skin has Risk Factor: Have certain diseases or conditions, such as hypothyroidism, diabetes or malnutrition
Dry skin has Complication: Atopic dermatitis (eczema).
Dry skin has Complication: Infections.
Dry skin has Preventio: Moisturize.
Dry skin has Preventio: Limit water exposure.
Dry skin has Preventio: Use a gentle cleanser or allergen-free soap.
Dry skin has Preventio: Shave with care.
Dry skin has Preventio: Cover as much skin as possible in cold or windy weather.
Dry skin has Preventio: Wear gloves.
Dry skin has Preventio: Rinse and moisturize after swimming.
Dry skin has Preventio: Drink when you're thirsty.
Dry skin has Preventio: Bathe babies with care.
Dry socket has Symptom: Severe pain within a few days after removing a tooth.
Dry socket has Symptom: Loss of part or all of the blood clot at the tooth removal site. The socket may look empty.
Dry socket has Symptom: Bone that you can see in the socket.
Dry socket has Symptom: Pain that spreads from the socket to your ear, eye, temple or neck on the same side of your face as the tooth removal.
Dry socket has Symptom: Bad breath or a foul odor coming from your mouth.
Dry socket has Symptom: Bad taste in your mouth.
Dry socket has Cause: Bacteria that gets into the socket.
Dry socket has Cause: Injury at the surgical site when tooth removal is difficult. This can happen with irregular wisdom tooth development or position, called an impacted wisdom tooth.
Dry socket has Risk Factor: Smoking and tobacco use.
Dry socket has Risk Factor: Birth control pills.
Dry socket has Risk Factor: Improper at-home care.
Dry socket has Risk Factor: Tooth or gum infection.

Dry socket has Complication: Even though a dry socket can be painful, it rarely causes an infection or serious complications. But healing in the socket may be delayed. Pain may last longer than usual after a tooth removal. Dry socket also may lead to an infection in the socket.
Dry socket has Preventio: You can take these steps to help prevent dry socket:
Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) has Symptom: A breast lump.
Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) has Symptom: Bloody nipple discharge.
Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) has Cause: It's not clear what causes ductal carcinoma in situ, also called DCIS.
Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) has Risk Factor: A family history of breast cancer.
Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) has Risk Factor: A personal history of breast cancer.
Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) has Risk Factor: A personal history of breast conditions.
Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) has Risk Factor: Beginning your period before age 12 increases the risk of breast cancer.
Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) has Risk Factor: Beginning menopause after age 55 increases the risk of breast cancer.
Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) has Risk Factor: Being female.
Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) has Risk Factor: Dense breast tissue.
Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) has Risk Factor: Drinking alcohol.
Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) has Risk Factor: Giving birth to your first child after age 30 may increase the risk of breast cancer.
Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) has Risk Factor: Having never been pregnant.
Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) has Risk Factor: The risk of breast cancer goes up as you get older.
Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) has Risk Factor: Inherited DNA changes that increase cancer risk.
Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) has Risk Factor: Menopausal hormone therapy.
Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) has Risk Factor: Obesity.
Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) has Risk Factor: Radiation exposure.

Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) has Preventio: Making changes in your daily life may help lower your risk of ductal carcinoma in situ. This early form of breast cancer also is called DCIS. To lower your risk of breast cancer, try to:
Dumping syndrome has Symptom: Symptoms of dumping syndrome generally start within minutes after eating, especially after a meal rich in table sugar or fruit sugar. They include:

Dumping syndrome has Cause: In dumping syndrome, food and gastric juices from your stomach move to your small intestine in an uncontrolled, abnormally fast manner. This is most often related to changes in your stomach associated with surgery. This includes any stomach surgery or major esophageal surgery, such as removal of the esophagus, called esophagectomy. But in rare cases, dumping syndrome can develop without a history of surgery or other obvious causes.

Dumping syndrome has Risk Factor: Surgery that alters the stomach can increase the risk of dumping syndrome. These surgeries are most commonly done to treat obesity, but also are part of treatment for stomach cancer, esophageal cancer and other conditions. These surgeries include:
Dupuytren contracture has Symptom: Dupuytren contracture gets worse slowly, over years. The condition begins with a firm lump in the palm of the hand. This lump can be painful or painless.
Dupuytren contracture has Cause: The cause of Dupuytren contracture is unknown. The condition tends to run in families. It’s more common in men than in women.
Dupuytren contracture has Risk Factor: Dupuytren contracture occurs most commonly after the age of 50.
Dupuytren contracture has Risk Factor: Men are much more likely to develop Dupuytren than are women. In men, symptoms may be worse and progress more quickly.
Dupuytren contracture has Risk Factor: Ancestry.
Dupuytren contracture has Risk Factor: Family history.
Dupuytren contracture has Risk Factor: Occupation.
Dupuytren contracture has Risk Factor: Diabetes.
Dupuytren contracture has Risk Factor: Tobacco and alcohol use.
Dural arteriovenous fistulas has Symptom: Sudden headache.
Dural arteriovenous fistulas has Symptom: Trouble walking and falls.
Dural arteriovenous fistulas has Symptom: Seizures.
Dural arteriovenous fistulas has Symptom: Speech or language issues.
Dural arteriovenous fistulas has Symptom: Facial pain.
Dural arteriovenous fistulas has Symptom: Dementia.
Dural arteriovenous fistulas has Symptom: Slowed movement, stiffness and tremor, known as parkinsonism.
Dural arteriovenous fistulas has Symptom: Trouble with coordination.
Dural arteriovenous fistulas has Symptom: Burning or prickling sensations.
Dural arteriovenous fistulas has Symptom: Weakness.
Dural arteriovenous fistulas has Symptom: Lack of interest, known as apathy.
Dural arteriovenous fistulas has Symptom: Failure to thrive.
Dural arteriovenous fistulas has Symptom: Symptoms related to increased pressure, such as headaches, nausea and vomiting.

Dural arteriovenous fistulas has Cause: Most dural arteriovenous fistulas (dAVFs) have no clear origin. But some result from a traumatic head injury, infection, previous brain surgery, blood clots in deep veins or tumors.

Dural arteriovenous fistulas has Risk Factor: Risk factors of dural arteriovenous fistulas (dAVFs) include being inclined to blood clots in the vein, known as vein thrombosis. Changes in the way the blood clots may increase the risk of a blockage or narrowing of the venous sinuses.
Dust mite allergy has Symptom: In dust mite allergies, swelling, called inflammation, of the inside of the nose, causes:

Dust mite allergy has Cause: Allergies occur when the body's protective network, called the immune system, reacts to everyday things such as pollen, pet dander or dust mites. The immune system acts as though whatever causes the allergy is harmful, even though it's not.
Dust mite allergy has Risk Factor: The following can increase the risk of having a dust mite allergy:
Dust mite allergy has Complication: For people with a dust mite allergy, being around the mites can cause:
Dwarfism has Symptom: Symptoms — other than short stature — vary greatly across the range of dwarfism conditions.

Dwarfism has Cause: Most often dwarfism is caused by gene changes, also called genetic variants. In many children, it's due to a random change in a child's gene. But dwarfism also can be inherited due to a genetic variant in one or both parents. Other causes can include low levels of hormones and poor nutrition. Sometimes the cause of dwarfism is not known.

Dwarfism has Risk Factor: Risk factors depend on the type of dwarfism. In many cases, a gene change related to dwarfism happens at random and is not passed from parent to child. If one or both parents have dwarfism, the risk of having a child with dwarfism rises.
Dwarfism has Complication: Complications of dwarfism-related conditions can vary greatly, but some complications are common to several conditions.
Dysarthria has Symptom: Slurred speech.
Dysarthria has Symptom: Slow speech.
Dysarthria has Symptom: Not being able to speak louder than a whisper or speaking too loudly.
Dysarthria has Symptom: Rapid speech that is difficult to understand.
Dysarthria has Symptom: Nasal, raspy or strained voice.
Dysarthria has Symptom: Uneven speech rhythm.
Dysarthria has Symptom: Uneven speech volume.
Dysarthria has Symptom: Monotone speech.
Dysarthria has Symptom: Trouble moving your tongue or facial muscles.
Dysarthria has Cause: Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, also known as ALS or Lou Gehrig's disease.
Dysarthria has Cause: Brain injury.
Dysarthria has Cause: Brain tumor.
Dysarthria has Cause: Cerebral palsy.
Dysarthria has Cause: Guillain-Barre syndrome.
Dysarthria has Cause: Head injury.
Dysarthria has Cause: Huntington's disease.
Dysarthria has Cause: Lyme disease.
Dysarthria has Cause: Multiple sclerosis.
Dysarthria has Cause: Muscular dystrophy.
Dysarthria has Cause: Myasthenia gravis.
Dysarthria has Cause: Parkinson's disease.
Dysarthria has Cause: Stroke.
Dysarthria has Cause: Wilson's disease.
Dysarthria has Risk Factor: Dysarthria risk factors include having a neurological condition that affects the muscles that control speech.
Dysarthria has Complication: Trouble socializing.
Dysarthria has Complication: Depression.

Dyshidrosis has Symptom: Dyshidrosis symptoms include painful, itchy and fluid-filled blisters on the sides of the fingers, the palms of the hands and the bottoms of the feet. The blisters are small — about the width of a standard pencil lead. They are grouped in clusters and can look like tapioca.

Dyshidrosis has Cause: The cause of dyshidrosis isn't known. It tends to happen in people who have a skin condition called atopic dermatitis (eczema) and allergic conditions, such as hay fever or glove allergy. Dyshidrosis isn't contagious.
Dyshidrosis has Risk Factor: Stress.
Dyshidrosis has Risk Factor: Exposure to certain metals.
Dyshidrosis has Risk Factor: Sensitive skin.
Dyshidrosis has Risk Factor: Atopic dermatitis.

Dyshidrosis has Complication: For most people with dyshidrosis, it's just an itchy inconvenience. For others, the pain and itching may limit the use of their hands or feet. Intense scratching can increase the risk of a bacterial infection of the affected skin.
Dyshidrosis has Preventio: Using mild, nonsoap cleansers and lukewarm water to wash your hands.
Dyshidrosis has Preventio: Drying your hands well.
Dyshidrosis has Preventio: Applying moisturizer at least twice a day.

Dyshidrosis has Preventio: Wearing gloves. But if you notice that wearing gloves worsens the rash, you may be sensitive to gloves. Let your doctor know about this. Try cotton gloves to prevent irritation. For wet activities, you might try wearing cotton gloves under waterproof gloves.

Dyslexia has Symptom: Signs of dyslexia can be difficult to recognize before your child enters school, but some early clues may indicate a problem. Once your child reaches school age, your child's teacher may be the first to notice a problem. Severity varies, but the condition often becomes apparent as a child starts learning to read.

Dyslexia has Cause: Dyslexia results from individual differences in the parts of the brain that enable reading. It tends to run in families. Dyslexia appears to be linked to certain genes that affect how the brain processes reading and language.
Dyslexia has Risk Factor: A family history of dyslexia or other reading or learning disabilities increases the risk of having dyslexia.
Dyslexia has Complication: Trouble learning.
Dyslexia has Complication: Social problems.
Dyslexia has Complication: Problems as adults.
Dysphagia has Symptom: Pain while swallowing.
Dysphagia has Symptom: Not being able to swallow.
Dysphagia has Symptom: Feeling as if food is stuck in the throat or chest or behind the breastbone.
Dysphagia has Symptom: Drooling.
Dysphagia has Symptom: Hoarseness.
Dysphagia has Symptom: Food coming back up, called regurgitation.
Dysphagia has Symptom: Frequent heartburn.
Dysphagia has Symptom: Food or stomach acid backing up into the throat.
Dysphagia has Symptom: Weight loss.
Dysphagia has Symptom: Coughing or gagging when swallowing.

Dysphagia has Cause: Swallowing is complex, involving many muscles and nerves. Any condition that weakens or damages these muscles and nerves or causes narrowing of the back of the throat or esophagus can cause dysphagia.
Dysphagia has Risk Factor: Aging.
Dysphagia has Risk Factor: Certain health conditions.
Dysphagia has Complication: Malnutrition, weight loss and dehydration.
Dysphagia has Complication: Aspiration pneumonia.
Dysphagia has Complication: Choking.

Dysphagia has Preventio: Although swallowing difficulties can't be prevented, you can reduce your risk of occasional difficulty swallowing by eating slowly and chewing your food well. However, if you have symptoms of dysphagia, see a healthcare professional.

Dystonia has Symptom: Begin in a single area, such as your leg, neck or arm. Focal dystonia that begins after age 21 usually starts in the neck, arm or face. Although it tends to remain in the single area, it may spread to a neighboring area of the body.
Dystonia has Symptom: Occur during a specific action, such as writing by hand.
Dystonia has Symptom: Worsen with stress, fatigue or anxiety.
Dystonia has Symptom: Become more noticeable over time.
Dystonia has Cause: Parkinson's disease.
Dystonia has Cause: Huntington's disease.
Dystonia has Cause: Wilson's disease.
Dystonia has Cause: Traumatic brain injury.
Dystonia has Cause: Birth injury.
Dystonia has Cause: Stroke.
Dystonia has Cause: Brain tumor or certain conditions that develop in some people with cancer, known as paraneoplastic syndromes.
Dystonia has Cause: Lack of oxygen or carbon monoxide poisoning.
Dystonia has Cause: Infections, such as tuberculosis or encephalitis.
Dystonia has Cause: Reactions to certain medicines or heavy metal poisoning.
Dystonia has Risk Factor: Your risk for dystonia increases if you have a family history of the movement disorder. Women also have a higher risk. They have dystonia twice as often as men do.
Dystonia has Complication: Physical disabilities that affect daily activities or specific tasks.
Dystonia has Complication: Trouble with vision.
Dystonia has Complication: Trouble moving the jaw, swallowing or speaking.
Dystonia has Complication: Pain and fatigue from the constant contraction of your muscles.
Dystonia has Complication: Depression, anxiety and social withdrawal.
E. coli has Symptom: Diarrhea, which may range from mild and watery to severe and bloody
E. coli has Symptom: Stomach cramping, pain or tenderness
E. coli has Symptom: Nausea and vomiting, in some people

E. coli has Cause: Only a few strains ofE. colitrigger diarrhea. TheE. coliO157:H7 strain belongs to a group ofE. colithat produces a powerful toxin that damages the lining of the small intestine. This can cause bloody diarrhea. You develop anE. coliinfection when you ingest this strain of bacteria.
E. coli has Risk Factor: Young children and older adults are at higher risk of experiencing illness caused byE. coliand more-serious complications from the infection.
E. coli has Risk Factor: Weakened immune systems.
E. coli has Risk Factor: Eating certain types of food.
E. coli has Risk Factor: Time of year.
E. coli has Risk Factor: Decreased stomach acid levels.

E. coli has Complication: Most healthy adults recover fromE. coliillness within a week. Some people — particularly young children and older adults — may develop a life-threatening form of kidney failure called hemolytic uremic syndrome.

E. coli has Preventio: No vaccine or medication can protect you fromE. coli-based illness, though researchers are investigating potential vaccines. To reduce your chance of being exposed toE. coli, avoid swallowing water from lakes or pools, wash your hands often, avoid risky foods, and watch out for cross-contamination.
Ear infection (middle ear) has Symptom: Symptoms of ear infection often come on fast.

Ear infection (middle ear) has Cause: A bacterium or virus in the middle ear causes an ear infection. This infection often comes from another illness, such as a cold, flu or allergy. These can cause the inside the nose, throat and ears to be swollen and stuffy.
Ear infection (middle ear) has Risk Factor: Risk factors for ear infections include:
Ear infection (middle ear) has Complication: Most ear infections don't cause long-term complications. Ear infections that happen again and again can lead to serious complications:
Ear infection (middle ear) has Preventio: The following tips may lower the risk of getting ear infections:
Earwax blockage has Symptom: Symptoms of earwax blockage may include:

Earwax blockage has Cause: The wax in your ears is made by glands in the skin of your outer ear canal. The wax and tiny hairs in these passages trap dust and other materials that could damage deeper parts of your ear, such as your eardrum.

Eating disorders has Symptom: Symptoms vary, depending on the type of eating disorder. Anorexia, bulimia and binge-eating disorder are the most common eating disorders. People with eating disorders can have all different body types and sizes.
Eating disorders has Cause: Genetics.
Eating disorders has Cause: Biology.
Eating disorders has Risk Factor: Family history.
Eating disorders has Risk Factor: Other mental health issues.
Eating disorders has Risk Factor: Dieting and starvation.
Eating disorders has Risk Factor: A history of weight bullying.
Eating disorders has Risk Factor: Stress.
Eating disorders has Complication: Serious health problems.
Eating disorders has Complication: Depression and anxiety.
Eating disorders has Complication: Suicidal thoughts or behavior.
Eating disorders has Complication: Problems with growth and development.
Eating disorders has Complication: Social and relationship problems.
Eating disorders has Complication: Substance use disorders.
Eating disorders has Complication: Work and school issues.
Eating disorders has Complication: Death.

Eating disorders has Preventio: There's no sure way to prevent eating disorders, but you can take steps to develop healthy eating habits. If you have a child, you can help your child lower the risk of developing eating disorders.
Ebstein anomaly has Symptom: Blue or gray lips or fingernails. Depending on skin color, these color changes may be harder or easier to see.
Ebstein anomaly has Symptom: Fatigue.
Ebstein anomaly has Symptom: Feeling of a pounding or rapid heartbeat or irregular heartbeats.
Ebstein anomaly has Symptom: Shortness of breath, especially with activity.
Ebstein anomaly has Cause: Ebstein anomaly is a heart condition that a person is born with. The cause is not known. To understand more about Ebstein anomaly, it may help to know how the heart works.
Ebstein anomaly has Risk Factor: Ebstein anomaly occurs as the baby, also called a fetus, grows in the womb during pregnancy.
Ebstein anomaly has Complication: Irregular heartbeats.
Ebstein anomaly has Complication: Heart failure.
Ebstein anomaly has Complication: Sudden cardiac arrest.
Ebstein anomaly has Complication: Stroke.

Ectopic pregnancy has Symptom: You may not notice any symptoms at first. However, some women who have an ectopic pregnancy have the usual early signs or symptoms of pregnancy — a missed period, breast tenderness and nausea.

Ectopic pregnancy has Cause: A tubal pregnancy — the most common type of ectopic pregnancy — happens when a fertilized egg gets stuck on its way to the uterus, often because the fallopian tube is damaged by inflammation or is misshapen. Hormonal imbalances or abnormal development of the fertilized egg also might play a role.
Ectopic pregnancy has Risk Factor: Some things that make you more likely to have an ectopic pregnancy are:
Ectopic pregnancy has Complication: An ectopic pregnancy can cause your fallopian tube to burst open. Without treatment, the ruptured tube can lead to life-threatening bleeding.
Ectopic pregnancy has Preventio: There's no way to prevent an ectopic pregnancy, but here are some ways to decrease your risk:
Ectropion has Symptom: Watery eyes (excessive tearing).
Ectropion has Symptom: Excessive dryness.
Ectropion has Symptom: Irritation.
Ectropion has Symptom: Sensitivity to light.
Ectropion has Cause: Muscle weakness.
Ectropion has Cause: Facial paralysis.
Ectropion has Cause: Scars or previous surgeries.
Ectropion has Cause: Eyelid growths.
Ectropion has Cause: Genetic disorders.
Ectropion has Risk Factor: The most common cause of ectropion is weakening muscle tissue associated with aging.
Ectropion has Risk Factor: Previous eye surgeries.
Ectropion has Risk Factor: Previous cancer, burns or trauma.

Ectropion has Complication: Ectropion leaves your cornea irritated and exposed, making it more susceptible to drying. The result can be abrasions and ulcers on the cornea, which can threaten your vision.
Edema has Symptom: Swelling or puffiness of the tissue right under the skin, especially in legs or arms.
Edema has Symptom: Stretched or shiny skin.
Edema has Symptom: Skin that holds a dimple, also known as pitting, after it's been pressed for a few seconds.
Edema has Symptom: Swelling of the belly, also called the abdomen, so that it's bigger than usual.
Edema has Symptom: Feeling of leg heaviness.
Edema has Cause: Sitting or staying in one position for too long.
Edema has Cause: Eating too much salty food.
Edema has Cause: Being premenstrual.
Edema has Cause: Being pregnant.
Edema has Risk Factor: Being pregnant.
Edema has Risk Factor: Taking certain medicines.
Edema has Risk Factor: Having a long-lasting illness, such as congestive heart failure or liver or kidney disease.
Edema has Risk Factor: Having surgery that involves a lymph node.
Edema has Complication: Swelling that gets more and more painful.
Edema has Complication: Problems walking.
Edema has Complication: Stiffness.
Edema has Complication: Stretched skin, which can itch.
Edema has Complication: Increased risk of infection in the swollen area.
Edema has Complication: Scarring between layers of tissue.
Edema has Complication: Less blood flow.
Edema has Complication: Less ability of the of arteries, veins, joints and muscles to stretch.
Edema has Complication: Increased risk of skin ulcers.
Egg allergy has Symptom: Egg allergy symptoms vary from person to person. They usually happen soon after eating an egg or a food made with egg. Egg allergy symptoms can include:

Egg allergy has Cause: An immune system reaction causes food allergies. For egg allergy, the immune system mistakenly targets certain egg proteins as harmful. When you or your child comes in contact with egg proteins, immune system cells called antibodies recognize them. The antibodies signal the immune system to release chemicals that cause allergy symptoms.
Egg allergy has Risk Factor: Certain factors can raise the risk of egg allergy:
Egg allergy has Complication: The most dangerous complication of egg allergy is a severe allergic reaction that needs treatment with an epinephrine shot and emergency care.
Egg allergy has Preventio: Here are some things you can do to help prevent an allergic reaction. These steps also can help keep a reaction from getting worse if one happens.
Ehlers-Danlos syndrome has Symptom: Overly flexible joints.
Ehlers-Danlos syndrome has Symptom: Stretchy skin.
Ehlers-Danlos syndrome has Symptom: Fragile skin.

Ehlers-Danlos syndrome has Cause: Different types of Ehlers-Danlos syndrome are associated with a variety of genetic causes, some of which are inherited and passed on from parent to child. If you have the most common form, hypermobile Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, there's a 50% chance that you'll pass on the gene to each of your children.

Ehlers-Danlos syndrome has Complication: Complications depend on the types of signs and symptoms you have. For example, overly flexible joints can result in joint dislocations and early-onset arthritis. Fragile skin may develop prominent scarring.

Ehlers-Danlos syndrome has Preventio: If you have a personal or family history of Ehlers-Danlos syndrome and you're thinking about starting a family, you may benefit from talking to a genetic counselor — a health care professional trained to assess the risk of inherited disorders. Genetic counseling can help you understand the inheritance pattern of the type of Ehlers-Danlos syndrome that affects you and the risks it poses for your children.
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Symptom: Moderate fever
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Symptom: Chills
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Symptom: Headache
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Symptom: Muscles aches or pains
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Symptom: General feeling of being unwell
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Symptom: Joint pain
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Symptom: Nausea
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Symptom: Vomiting
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Symptom: Diarrhea
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Symptom: Loss of appetite
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Cause: Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis are caused by different bacteria.
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Risk Factor: Being outdoors in warm spring and summer months
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Risk Factor: Participating in activities in wooded areas, such as camping, hiking or hunting
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Risk Factor: Wearing clothes that leave your skin exposed in tick-friendly habitat
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Complication: Kidney failure
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Complication: Respiratory failure
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Complication: Heart failure
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Complication: Damage to the central nervous system
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Complication: Seizures
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Complication: Coma
Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Complication: Severe secondary infections

Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis has Preventio: The best way to steer clear of ehrlichiosis or anaplasmosis is to avoid tick bites when you are outdoors. Most ticks attach themselves to your lower legs and feet as you walk or work in grassy, wooded areas or overgrown fields. After a tick attaches to your body, it usually crawls upward to find a location to burrow into your skin.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Symptom: Blue or gray skin. Depending on skin color, these changes may be harder or easier to see.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Symptom: Chest pain or tightness.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Symptom: Coughing up blood.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Symptom: Dizziness or fainting.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Symptom: Easily tiring and shortness of breath with activity.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Symptom: Headaches.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Symptom: Large, rounded fingernails or toenails, called clubbing.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Symptom: Numbness or tingling in fingers or toes.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Symptom: Shortness of breath while at rest.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Symptom: Skipped or racing heartbeats.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Cause: Ventricular septal defect.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Cause: Atrioventricular canal defect.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Cause: Atrial septal defect.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Cause: Patent ductus arteriosus.

Eisenmenger syndrome has Risk Factor: A family history of congenital heart defects increases the risk of similar heart problems in a baby. If you've been diagnosed with Eisenmenger syndrome, talk with your healthcare professional about screening other family members for congenital heart defects.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Complication: Low blood oxygen levels.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Complication: Irregular heartbeats, also called arrhythmias.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Complication: Sudden cardiac arrest.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Complication: Heart failure.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Complication: Bleeding in the lungs.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Complication: Stroke.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Complication: Kidney disease.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Complication: Gout.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Complication: Heart infection.
Eisenmenger syndrome has Complication: Pregnancy risks.

Elevated blood pressure has Symptom: Elevated blood pressure doesn't cause symptoms. The only way to detect it is to have regular blood pressure checks. Have your blood pressure measured when you visit your health care provider. You can also check it at home with a home blood pressure monitoring device.

Elevated blood pressure has Cause: Anything that increases pressure on the artery walls can lead to elevated blood pressure. A buildup of fats, cholesterol, and other substances in and on the artery walls (atherosclerosis) can cause elevated blood pressure. But the opposite is also true. High blood pressure (hypertension) can cause atherosclerosis.
Elevated blood pressure has Risk Factor: Anyone can have elevated blood pressure, even children.

Elevated blood pressure has Complication: Elevated blood pressure can worsen and develop into long-term high blood pressure as a health condition (hypertension). Hypertension can damage body organs. It increases the risk of heart attacks, heart failure, strokes, aneurysms and kidney failure.

Elevated blood pressure has Preventio: The same healthy lifestyle changes recommended to treat elevated blood pressure also help prevent it. Eat healthy foods, use less salt, don't smoke, exercise regularly, maintain a healthy weight, avoid or limit alcohol, and manage stress.
Embryonal tumors has Symptom: Headaches.
Embryonal tumors has Symptom: Nausea.
Embryonal tumors has Symptom: Vomiting.
Embryonal tumors has Symptom: Feeling more tired than usual.
Embryonal tumors has Symptom: Double vision.
Embryonal tumors has Symptom: Difficulty with balance.
Embryonal tumors has Symptom: Seizures.

Embryonal tumors has Cause: The cause of an embryonal tumor often isn't known. This cancer causes a growth of cells in the brain. The growth involves cells that are left over from fetal development, called embryonal cells.
Embryonal tumors has Risk Factor: This cancer can happen at any age. But it happens most often in children.
Embryonal tumors has Risk Factor: Hereditary syndromes.
Emphysema has Symptom: Shortness of breath, especially with physical activity. This is the main symptom of emphysema.
Emphysema has Symptom: Wheezing, whistling or squeaking sound when you breathe out.
Emphysema has Symptom: Coughing.
Emphysema has Symptom: Chest tightness or heaviness.
Emphysema has Symptom: Feeling very tired.
Emphysema has Symptom: Weight loss and ankle swelling that may happen as the condition gets worse over time.
Emphysema has Cause: Smoking cigarettes, which is the most common cause.
Emphysema has Cause: Chemical fumes, especially in the workplace.
Emphysema has Cause: Vapors and dusts, especially in the workplace.
Emphysema has Risk Factor: Smoking.
Emphysema has Risk Factor: Being around secondhand smoke.
Emphysema has Risk Factor: Job exposure to fumes, vapors or dust.
Emphysema has Risk Factor: Exposure to indoor and outdoor pollution.
Emphysema has Risk Factor: Genetics.
Emphysema has Complication: High blood pressure in lung arteries.
Emphysema has Complication: Other heart problems.
Emphysema has Complication: Large air spaces in the lungs.
Emphysema has Complication: Collapsed lung.
Emphysema has Complication: Lung cancer.
Emphysema has Complication: Anxiety and depression.
Emphysema has Preventio: Don't smoke. Talk to your healthcare professional about options for quitting.
Emphysema has Preventio: Stay away from secondhand smoke.
Emphysema has Preventio: Wear a special mask or use other measures to protect your lungs if you work with chemical fumes, vapors or dust.
Emphysema has Preventio: Avoid exposure to secondhand smoke and air pollution when possible.
Encephalitis has Symptom: Headache.
Encephalitis has Symptom: Fever.
Encephalitis has Symptom: Aches in muscles or joints.
Encephalitis has Symptom: Fatigue or weakness.
Encephalitis has Cause: Infectious encephalitis.
Encephalitis has Cause: Autoimmune encephalitis.

Encephalitis has Risk Factor: Some types of encephalitis are more common or more serious in certain age groups. In general, young children and older adults are at greater risk of most types of viral encephalitis. Similarly, some forms of autoimmune encephalitis are more common in children and young adults, whereas others are more common in older adults.
Encephalitis has Risk Factor: Weakened immune system.
Encephalitis has Risk Factor: Geographical regions.
Encephalitis has Risk Factor: Season of the year.
Encephalitis has Risk Factor: Autoimmune disease.
Encephalitis has Risk Factor: Smoking.
Encephalitis has Complication: Your age.
Encephalitis has Complication: The cause of your infection.
Encephalitis has Complication: The severity of your initial illness.
Encephalitis has Complication: The time from disease onset to treatment.
Encephalitis has Preventio: Practice good hygiene.
Encephalitis has Preventio: Don't share utensils.
Encephalitis has Preventio: Teach your children good habits.
Encephalitis has Preventio: Get vaccinations.
Encopresis has Symptom: Symptoms of encopresis may include:
Encopresis has Cause: There are several causes of encopresis, including constipation and emotional issues.
Encopresis has Risk Factor: Encopresis is more common in boys than in girls. These risk factors may increase the chances of having encopresis:

Encopresis has Complication: A child who has encopresis may experience a range of emotions, including embarrassment, frustration, shame and anger. If teased by friends or criticized or punished by adults, the child may feel depressed or have low self-esteem.
Encopresis has Preventio: Below are some strategies that can help prevent encopresis and its complications.

Endocarditis has Symptom: Symptoms of endocarditis can vary from person to person. Endocarditis may develop slowly or suddenly. It depends on the type of germs causing the infection and whether there are other heart problems.

Endocarditis has Cause: Endocarditis is usually caused by an infection with bacteria, fungi or other germs. The germs enter the bloodstream and travel to the heart. In the heart, they attach to damaged heart valves or damaged heart tissue.

Endocarditis has Risk Factor: Many different things can cause germs to get into the bloodstream and lead to endocarditis. Having a faulty, diseased or damaged heart valve increases the risk of the condition. However, endocarditis may occur in those without heart valve problems.

Endocarditis has Complication: In endocarditis, irregular growths made of germs and cell pieces form a mass in the heart. These clumps are called vegetations. They can break loose and travel to the brain, lungs, kidneys and other organs. They can also travel to the arms and legs.
Endocarditis has Preventio: You can take the following steps to help prevent endocarditis:
Endometrial cancer has Symptom: Vaginal bleeding after menopause.
Endometrial cancer has Symptom: Bleeding between periods.
Endometrial cancer has Symptom: Pelvic pain.
Endometrial cancer has Cause: The cause of endometrial cancer isn't known. What's known is that something happens to cells in the lining of the uterus that changes them into cancer cells.
Endometrial cancer has Risk Factor: Changes in the balance of hormones in the body.
Endometrial cancer has Risk Factor: More years of menstruation.
Endometrial cancer has Risk Factor: Never having been pregnant.
Endometrial cancer has Risk Factor: As you get older, your risk of endometrial cancer increases. Endometrial cancer occurs most often after menopause.
Endometrial cancer has Risk Factor: Obesity.
Endometrial cancer has Risk Factor: Hormone therapy for breast cancer.
Endometrial cancer has Risk Factor: An inherited syndrome that increases the risk of cancer.
Endometrial cancer has Preventio: Talk to your health care team about the risks of hormone therapy after menopause.
Endometrial cancer has Preventio: Consider taking birth control pills.
Endometrial cancer has Preventio: Maintain a healthy weight.
Endometriosis has Symptom: Painful periods.
Endometriosis has Symptom: Pain with sex.
Endometriosis has Symptom: Pain with bowel movements or urination.
Endometriosis has Symptom: Excessive bleeding.
Endometriosis has Symptom: Infertility.
Endometriosis has Symptom: Other symptoms.
Endometriosis has Cause: Retrograde menstruation.
Endometriosis has Cause: Transformed peritoneal cells.
Endometriosis has Cause: Embryonic cell changes.
Endometriosis has Cause: Surgical scar complication.
Endometriosis has Cause: Endometrial cell transport.
Endometriosis has Cause: Immune system condition.
Endometriosis has Risk Factor: Never giving birth.
Endometriosis has Risk Factor: Starting your period at an early age.
Endometriosis has Risk Factor: Going through menopause at an older age.
Endometriosis has Risk Factor: Short menstrual cycles — for instance, less than 27 days.
Endometriosis has Risk Factor: Heavy menstrual periods that last longer than seven days.
Endometriosis has Risk Factor: Having higher levels of estrogen in your body or a greater lifetime exposure to estrogen your body produces.
Endometriosis has Risk Factor: Low body mass index.
Endometriosis has Risk Factor: One or more relatives with endometriosis, such as a mother, aunt or sister.
End-stage renal disease has Symptom: Nausea
End-stage renal disease has Symptom: Vomiting
End-stage renal disease has Symptom: Loss of appetite
End-stage renal disease has Symptom: Fatigue and weakness
End-stage renal disease has Symptom: Changes in how much you urinate
End-stage renal disease has Symptom: Chest pain, if fluid builds up around the lining of the heart
End-stage renal disease has Symptom: Shortness of breath, if fluid builds up in the lungs
End-stage renal disease has Symptom: Swelling of feet and ankles
End-stage renal disease has Symptom: High blood pressure (hypertension) that's difficult to control
End-stage renal disease has Symptom: Headaches
End-stage renal disease has Symptom: Difficulty sleeping
End-stage renal disease has Symptom: Decreased mental sharpness
End-stage renal disease has Symptom: Muscle twitches and cramps
End-stage renal disease has Symptom: Persistent itching
End-stage renal disease has Symptom: Metallic taste
End-stage renal disease has Cause: Type 1 or type 2 diabetes
End-stage renal disease has Cause: High blood pressure
End-stage renal disease has Cause: Glomerulonephritis (gloe-mer-u-low-nuh-FRY-tis) — an inflammation of the kidney's filtering units (glomeruli)
End-stage renal disease has Cause: Interstitial nephritis (in-tur-STISH-ul nuh-FRY-tis), an inflammation of the kidney's tubules and surrounding structures
End-stage renal disease has Cause: Polycystic kidney disease or other inherited kidney diseases
End-stage renal disease has Cause: Prolonged obstruction of the urinary tract, from conditions such as enlarged prostate, kidney stones and some cancers
End-stage renal disease has Cause: Vesicoureteral (ves-ih-koe-yoo-REE-tur-ul) reflux, a condition that causes urine to back up into your kidneys
End-stage renal disease has Cause: Recurrent kidney infection, also called pyelonephritis (pie-uh-low-nuh-FRY-tis)
End-stage renal disease has Risk Factor: Diabetes with poor blood sugar control
End-stage renal disease has Risk Factor: Kidney disease that affects the glomeruli, the structures in the kidneys that filter wastes from the blood
End-stage renal disease has Risk Factor: Polycystic kidney disease
End-stage renal disease has Risk Factor: High blood pressure
End-stage renal disease has Risk Factor: Tobacco use
End-stage renal disease has Risk Factor: Black, Hispanic, Asian, Pacific Islander or American Indian heritage
End-stage renal disease has Risk Factor: Family history of kidney failure
End-stage renal disease has Risk Factor: Older age
End-stage renal disease has Risk Factor: Frequent use of medications that could be damaging to the kidney
End-stage renal disease has Complication: Fluid retention, which could lead to swelling in your arms and legs, high blood pressure, or fluid in your lungs (pulmonary edema)
End-stage renal disease has Complication: A sudden rise in potassium levels in your blood (hyperkalemia), which could impair your heart's ability to function and may be life-threatening
End-stage renal disease has Complication: Heart disease
End-stage renal disease has Complication: Weak bones and an increased risk of bone fractures
End-stage renal disease has Complication: Anemia
End-stage renal disease has Complication: Decreased sex drive, erectile dysfunction or reduced fertility
End-stage renal disease has Complication: Damage to your central nervous system, which can cause difficulty concentrating, personality changes or seizures
End-stage renal disease has Complication: Decreased immune response, which makes you more vulnerable to infection
End-stage renal disease has Complication: Pericarditis, an inflammation of the saclike membrane that envelops your heart (pericardium)
End-stage renal disease has Complication: Pregnancy complications that carry risks for the mother and the developing fetus
End-stage renal disease has Complication: Malnutrition
End-stage renal disease has Complication: Irreversible damage to your kidneys (end-stage kidney disease), eventually requiring either dialysis or a kidney transplant for survival
End-stage renal disease has Preventio: Achieve and maintain a healthy weight
End-stage renal disease has Preventio: Be active most days
End-stage renal disease has Preventio: Limit protein and eat a balanced diet of nutritious, low-sodium foods
End-stage renal disease has Preventio: Control your blood pressure
End-stage renal disease has Preventio: Take your medications as prescribed
End-stage renal disease has Preventio: Have your cholesterol levels checked every year
End-stage renal disease has Preventio: Control your blood sugar level
End-stage renal disease has Preventio: Don't smoke or use tobacco products
End-stage renal disease has Preventio: Get regular checkups
Enlarged breasts in men (gynecomastia) has Symptom: Pain, especially in teenagers.
Enlarged breasts in men (gynecomastia) has Symptom: Swollen breast tissue.
Enlarged breasts in men (gynecomastia) has Symptom: Tender breasts.
Enlarged breasts in men (gynecomastia) has Symptom: Sensitive nipples when they rub against clothes.

Enlarged breasts in men (gynecomastia) has Cause: In people assigned male at birth, the body mainly makes the sex hormone testosterone. It also makes small amounts of the hormone estrogen. Gynecomastia can happen when the amount of testosterone in the body drops compared with estrogen. The decrease can be caused by conditions that lower testosterone or block its effects. Or it can be caused by conditions that raise the estrogen level.
Enlarged breasts in men (gynecomastia) has Risk Factor: Puberty.
Enlarged breasts in men (gynecomastia) has Risk Factor: Older age.
Enlarged breasts in men (gynecomastia) has Risk Factor: Obesity.

Esophageal cancer has Cause: Esophageal cancer happens when cells lining the esophagus develop changes in their DNA. A cell's DNA holds the instructions that tell the cell what to do. In healthy cells, the DNA gives instructions to grow and multiply at a set rate. The instructions tell the cells to die at a set time. In cancer cells, the DNA changes give different instructions. The changes tell the cancer cells to make many more cells quickly. Cancer cells can keep living when healthy cells would die. This causes too many cells.

Exercise-induced asthma has Symptom: Symptoms of exercise-induced asthma usually begin during or soon after exercise. These symptoms can last for an hour or longer if untreated. Symptoms include:

Exercise-induced asthma has Cause: It's not exactly clear what causes exercise-induced asthma. For a long time, the cause was thought to be cold air. However, recent studies found dry air to be a more likely culprit. Cold air contains less moisture than warm air. Breathing in cold, dry air dehydrates the air passages. This causes them to narrow, reducing air flow. Other factors, such as chlorine or other fumes, can irritate the lining of the airways and contribute to breathing difficulties.
