Subconjunctival hemorrhage (broken blood vessel in eye) has Symptom: The main sign of a subconjunctival hemorrhage is a bright red patch on the white part of the eye.

Subconjunctival hemorrhage (broken blood vessel in eye) has Cause: The cause of a subconjunctival hemorrhage isn't always known. The following actions may cause a tiny blood vessel to rupture in the eye:
Subconjunctival hemorrhage (broken blood vessel in eye) has Risk Factor: Risk factors for a subconjunctival hemorrhage include:

Subconjunctival hemorrhage (broken blood vessel in eye) has Complication: Health complications from a subconjunctival hemorrhage are rare. If the bleeding is due to trauma, your healthcare professional may check the eye for complications or injury.

Subconjunctival hemorrhage (broken blood vessel in eye) has Preventio: If a subconjunctival hemorrhage is likely related to a medical condition or blood-thinning medicine, ask your healthcare professional about taking steps to reduce the risk of repeat episodes.
Sudden cardiac arrest has Symptom: Sudden collapse.
Sudden cardiac arrest has Symptom: No pulse.
Sudden cardiac arrest has Symptom: No breathing.
Sudden cardiac arrest has Symptom: Loss of consciousness.
Sudden cardiac arrest has Cause: A change in the heart's electrical activity causes sudden cardiac arrest. The change makes the heart stop pumping blood. No blood flow goes to the body.
Sudden cardiac arrest has Risk Factor: A family history of coronary artery disease.
Sudden cardiac arrest has Risk Factor: Smoking.
Sudden cardiac arrest has Risk Factor: High blood pressure.
Sudden cardiac arrest has Risk Factor: High blood cholesterol.
Sudden cardiac arrest has Risk Factor: Obesity.
Sudden cardiac arrest has Risk Factor: Diabetes.
Sudden cardiac arrest has Risk Factor: An inactive lifestyle.
Sudden cardiac arrest has Complication: When sudden cardiac arrest occurs, less blood flows to the brain. If the heart rhythm isn't rapidly restored, complications may include brain damage and death.
Sudden cardiac arrest has Preventio: Eat healthy.
Sudden cardiac arrest has Preventio: Stay active and get regular exercise.
Sudden cardiac arrest has Preventio: Do not smoke or use tobacco.
Sudden cardiac arrest has Preventio: Have regular checkups.
Sudden cardiac arrest has Preventio: Get screened for heart disease.
Sudden cardiac arrest has Preventio: Control blood pressure and cholesterol.
Sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) has Cause: Both physical and sleep factors put an infant at risk ofSIDS. These factors vary from child to child.
Sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) has Risk Factor: Boys are slightly more likely than girls to die ofSIDS.
Sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) has Risk Factor: Infants are at higher risk between the second and fourth months of life.
Sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) has Risk Factor: Race.
Sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) has Risk Factor: Family history.
Sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) has Risk Factor: Secondhand smoke.
Sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) has Risk Factor: Premature birth.
Sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) has Preventio: Back to sleep.
Sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) has Preventio: Keep the crib as bare as possible.
Sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) has Preventio: Don't overheat your baby.
Sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) has Preventio: Have your baby sleep in your room.
Sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) has Preventio: Breastfeed your baby, if possible.
Sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) has Preventio: Don't use baby monitors and other commercial devices that claim to reduce the risk ofSIDS.
Sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) has Preventio: Offer a pacifier.
Sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) has Preventio: Vaccinate your baby.
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Symptom: Talking about suicide — for example, making statements such as "I'm going to kill myself," "I wish I were dead" or "I wish I hadn't been born"
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Symptom: Getting the means to take your own life, such as buying a gun or stockpiling pills
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Symptom: Withdrawing from social contact and wanting to be left alone
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Symptom: Having mood swings, such as being emotionally high one day and deeply discouraged the next
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Symptom: Being preoccupied with death, dying or violence
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Symptom: Feeling trapped or hopeless about a situation
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Symptom: Increasing use of alcohol or drugs
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Symptom: Changing normal routine, including eating or sleeping patterns
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Symptom: Doing risky or self-destructive things, such as using drugs or driving recklessly
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Symptom: Giving away belongings or getting affairs in order when there's no other logical explanation for doing this
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Symptom: Saying goodbye to people as if they won't be seen again
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Symptom: Developing personality changes or being severely anxious or agitated, particularly when experiencing some of the warning signs listed above

Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Cause: Suicidal thoughts have many causes. Most often, suicidal thoughts are the result of feeling like you can't cope when you're faced with what seems to be an overwhelming life situation. If you don't have hope for the future, you may mistakenly think suicide is a solution. You may experience a sort of tunnel vision, where in the middle of a crisis you believe suicide is the only way out.
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Risk Factor: Attempted suicide before
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Risk Factor: Feel hopeless, worthless, agitated, socially isolated or lonely
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Risk Factor: Experience a stressful life event, such as the loss of a loved one, military service, a breakup, or financial or legal problems

Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Risk Factor: Have a substance abuse problem — alcohol and drug abuse can worsen thoughts of suicide and make you feel reckless or impulsive enough to act on your thoughts
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Risk Factor: Have suicidal thoughts and have access to firearms in your home
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Risk Factor: Have an underlying psychiatric disorder, such as major depression, post-traumatic stress disorder or bipolar disorder
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Risk Factor: Have a family history of mental disorders, substance abuse, suicide, or violence, including physical or sexual abuse
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Risk Factor: Have a medical condition that can be linked to depression and suicidal thinking, such as chronic disease, chronic pain or terminal illness
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Risk Factor: Are lesbian, gay, bisexual or transgender with an unsupportive family or in a hostile environment

Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Complication: Suicidal thoughts and attempted suicide take an emotional toll. For instance, you may be so consumed by suicidal thoughts that you can't function in your daily life. And while many attempted suicides are impulsive acts during a moment of crisis, they can leave you with permanent serious or severe injuries, such as organ failure or brain damage.
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Preventio: Get the treatment you need.
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Preventio: Establish your support network.
Suicide and suicidal thoughts has Preventio: Remember, suicidal feelings are temporary.
Sun allergy has Symptom: Itchiness (pruritus)
Sun allergy has Symptom: Stinging
Sun allergy has Symptom: Tiny bumps that may merge into raised patches
Sun allergy has Symptom: A flushing of the exposed area
Sun allergy has Symptom: Blisters or hives

Sun allergy has Cause: Causes of sun allergy include immune system reactions to sunlight, certain medications and chemicals that make the skin more sensitive to the sun. It isn't clear why some people have a sun allergy and others don't. Inherited traits may play a role.
Sun allergy has Risk Factor: Contact with certain substances.
Sun allergy has Risk Factor: Taking certain medications.
Sun allergy has Risk Factor: Having another skin condition.
Sun allergy has Risk Factor: Having a blood relative with a sun allergy.
Sun allergy has Preventio: Avoid sun exposure between 10 a.m. and 4 p.m.
Sun allergy has Preventio: Avoid sudden exposure to lots of sunlight.
Sun allergy has Preventio: Wear sunglasses and protective clothing.
Sun allergy has Preventio: Apply sunscreen.
Sun allergy has Preventio: Avoid known triggers.
Sun allergy has Preventio: ApplyUV-blocking window film.
Sunburn has Symptom: Inflamed skin, which looks pink or red on white skin and may be harder to see on brown or Black skin.
Sunburn has Symptom: Skin that feels warm or hot to the touch.
Sunburn has Symptom: Pain, tenderness and itching.
Sunburn has Symptom: Swelling.
Sunburn has Symptom: Small, fluid-filled blisters, which may break.
Sunburn has Symptom: Headache, fever, nausea and fatigue, if the sunburn is severe.
Sunburn has Symptom: Eyes that feel painful or gritty.

Sunburn has Cause: Sunburn is caused by too much exposure to ultraviolet (UV) light. UV light may be from the sun or artificial sources, such as sunlamps and tanning beds. UVA is the wavelength of light that can penetrate to the deep layers of skin and lead to skin damage over time. UVB is the wavelength of light that penetrates the skin more superficially and causes sunburn.
Sunburn has Risk Factor: Having white skin and red hair.
Sunburn has Risk Factor: Having a history of sunburn.
Sunburn has Risk Factor: Living or vacationing somewhere sunny, warm or at high altitude.
Sunburn has Risk Factor: Working outdoors.
Sunburn has Risk Factor: Swimming or spraying your skin with water or baby oil, as wet skin tends to burn more than does dry skin.
Sunburn has Risk Factor: Mixing outdoor recreation and drinking alcohol.
Sunburn has Risk Factor: Regularly exposing unprotected skin to UV light from sunlight or artificial sources, such as tanning beds.
Sunburn has Risk Factor: Taking a drug that makes you more likely to burn (photosensitizing medication).

Sunburn has Complication: Intense, repeated sun exposure that results in sunburn increases your risk of other skin damage and certain diseases. These include premature aging of skin (photoaging), precancerous skin lesions and skin cancer.
Sunburn has Preventio: Avoid sun exposure between 10 a.m. and 4 p.m.
Sunburn has Preventio: Avoid sun tanning and tanning beds.
Sunburn has Preventio: Use sunscreen often and generously.
Sunburn has Preventio: Protect babies and toddlers.
Sunburn has Preventio: Cover up.
Sunburn has Preventio: Wear sunglasses when outdoors.
Sunburn has Preventio: Be aware of sun-sensitizing medications and cosmetics.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Symptom: Pounding or fluttering feelings in the chest, called palpitations.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Symptom: A pounding sensation in the neck.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Symptom: Chest pain.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Symptom: Fainting or almost fainting.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Symptom: Lightheadedness or dizziness.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Symptom: Shortness of breath.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Symptom: Sweating.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Symptom: Weakness or extreme tiredness.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Cause: Supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) is caused by faulty signaling in the heart. Electrical signals in the heart control the heartbeat.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Risk Factor: Coronary artery disease, heart valve disease and other heart diseases.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Risk Factor: Heart failure.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Risk Factor: A heart problem present at birth, also called a congenital heart defect.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Risk Factor: Previous heart surgery.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Risk Factor: A sleep disorder called obstructive sleep apnea.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Risk Factor: Thyroid disease.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Risk Factor: Uncontrolled diabetes.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Risk Factor: Some medicines, including those used to treat asthma, allergies and colds.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Complication: When the heart beats too fast, it may not send enough blood to the body. As a result, the organs and tissues may not get enough oxygen.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Preventio: Follow a heart-healthy lifestyle.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Preventio: Don't use a lot of caffeine.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Preventio: Keep a notebook or diary of when symptoms happen.
Supraventricular tachycardia has Preventio: Use medicines carefully.
Suspicious breast lumps has Symptom: A round, smooth and firm breast lump.
Suspicious breast lumps has Symptom: A lump that feels firm and moves easily under the skin.
Suspicious breast lumps has Symptom: A hard breast lump with irregular edges.
Suspicious breast lumps has Symptom: An area of skin that has changed color.
Suspicious breast lumps has Symptom: Skin dimpling like an orange.
Suspicious breast lumps has Symptom: New changes in breast size or shape.
Suspicious breast lumps has Symptom: Fluid leaking from the nipple.
Suspicious breast lumps has Cause: Breast cysts.
Suspicious breast lumps has Cause: Fibrocystic breast changes.
Suspicious breast lumps has Cause: Fibroadenomas.
Suspicious breast lumps has Cause: Injury or post-surgery.
Suspicious breast lumps has Cause: Infections.
Suspicious breast lumps has Cause: Intraductal papilloma.
Suspicious breast lumps has Cause: Lipoma.
Suspicious breast lumps has Cause: Breast cancer.
Suspicious breast lumps has Risk Factor: Some conditions that cause breast lumps are more common in the 30s and 40s. These include fibrocystic changes and fibroadenomas.
Suspicious breast lumps has Risk Factor: Menstrual periods.
Suspicious breast lumps has Risk Factor: Pregnancy.
Suspicious breast lumps has Risk Factor: Premenopause.

Suspicious breast lumps has Complication: Some conditions that cause breast lumps may lead to other health concerns, also called complications. The complications depend on the type of breast lump that you have. For example, without treatment, some breast infections can cause pockets of pus to form in the breast.
Suspicious breast lumps has Preventio: Drink less alcohol.
Suspicious breast lumps has Preventio: Eat a balanced diet.
Suspicious breast lumps has Preventio: Exercise.

Sweating and body odor has Symptom: Sweating and body odor most often affect the underarm and groin areas, the palms, the bottom of the feet, and the head, face and scalp. It's common for some people to sweat more or less than other people. Body odor also can vary from person to person. It might smell tangy, oniony, sour or some other strong odor.
Sweating and body odor has Cause: Sweating is the body's way of cooling itself. The nervous system activates the sweat glands when you're too warm. Sweating also occurs when you're under stress.
Sweating and body odor has Risk Factor: Risk factors for sweating and body odor are:

Swimmer's ear has Symptom: Swimmer's ear symptoms are usually mild at first. But they can get worse if the infection isn't treated or spreads. Doctors often classify swimmer's ear as mild, moderate and advanced.
Swimmer's ear has Cause: Swimmer's ear is an infection that's usually caused by bacteria. It's less common for a fungus or virus to cause swimmer's ear.
Swimmer's ear has Risk Factor: The following can increase the risk of swimmer's ear:
Swimmer's ear has Complication: Swimmer's ear usually isn't serious if treated quickly. But complications that can happen include:
Swimmer's ear has Preventio: Follow these tips to avoid swimmer's ear:

Swimmer's itch has Symptom: Swimmer's itch symptoms include an itchy rash that looks like pimples or blisters. Symptoms may begin within minutes or as long as two days after swimming or wading in contaminated water.

Swimmer's itch has Cause: Swimmer's itch is caused by an allergic reaction to parasites that burrow into your skin from warm water. These parasites are found in some animals that live near ponds and lakes, including geese, ducks and muskrats.
Swimmer's itch has Risk Factor: Spending time in water that's infested with certain parasites.
Swimmer's itch has Risk Factor: Forgetting to dry off with a towel after getting out of the water.
Swimmer's itch has Risk Factor: Being sensitive to the parasites that cause swimmer's itch.
Swimmer's itch has Complication: Swimmer's itch usually isn't serious, but your skin can become infected if you scratch the rash.
Swimmer's itch has Preventio: Choose swimming spots carefully.
Swimmer's itch has Preventio: Rinse after swimming.
Swimmer's itch has Preventio: Skip the bread crumbs.
Swollen knee has Symptom: Signs and symptoms typically include:
Swollen knee has Cause: Many things can cause a swollen knee. They include traumatic injuries to diseases and other conditions.
Swollen knee has Risk Factor: Factors that may increase your risk of a swollen knee include:
Swollen knee has Complication: Complications of a swollen knee can include:
Swollen knee has Preventio: A swollen knee is typically the result of an injury or chronic health condition. To manage your overall health and prevent injuries:

Swollen lymph nodes has Symptom: The lymph system is a network of organs, vessels and lymph nodes throughout the body. Many lymph nodes are in the head and neck. Lymph nodes there often swell. Swelling can be to the size of a pea or kidney bean or larger.

Swollen lymph nodes has Cause: Lymph nodes are small, round or bean-shaped bunches of cells. Inside lymph nodes are a mix of types of immune system cells. These cells filter the lymph fluid as it goes through the body and protect the body from invaders.
Swollen lymph nodes has Risk Factor: Many conditions increase the risk of swollen lymph nodes. Factors that increase the risk of having these conditions include:

Swollen lymph nodes has Complication: When an infection that causes swollen lymph nodes isn't treated, a collection of pus may form. These are called abscesses. Pus contains fluid, white blood cells, dead tissue, and bacteria or other invaders. An abscess might need to be drained and treated with an antibiotic.
Synovial sarcoma has Symptom: A lump or bump under the skin that slowly gets bigger.
Synovial sarcoma has Symptom: Joint stiffness.
Synovial sarcoma has Symptom: Pain.
Synovial sarcoma has Symptom: Swelling.
Synovial sarcoma has Cause: It's not clear what causes synovial sarcoma.
Synovial sarcoma has Risk Factor: Younger age is a risk factor for synovial sarcoma. This cancer happens most often in older children and young adults.

Syphilis has Symptom: Syphilis develops in stages. The symptoms vary with each stage. But the stages may overlap. And the symptoms don't always happen in the same order. You may be infected with syphilis bacteria without noticing any symptoms for years.

Syphilis has Cause: The cause of syphilis is a bacterium called Treponema pallidum. The most common way syphilis spreads is through contact with an infected person's sore during vaginal, oral or anal sex.
Syphilis has Risk Factor: Have unprotected sex.
Syphilis has Risk Factor: Have sex with more than one partner.
Syphilis has Risk Factor: Live with HIV, the virus that causes AIDS if untreated.

Syphilis has Complication: Without treatment, syphilis can lead to damage throughout the body. Syphilis also raises the risk of HIV infection and can cause problems during pregnancy. Treatment can help prevent damage. But it can't repair or reverse damage that's already happened.
Syphilis has Preventio: Have safe sex or no sex.
Syphilis has Preventio: Use a latex condom.
Syphilis has Preventio: Be careful with alcohol and stay away from street drugs.
Syphilis has Preventio: Do not douche.
Syphilis has Preventio: Breastfeed with caution.
Syringomyelia has Symptom: Muscle weakness and muscle wasting.
Syringomyelia has Symptom: Loss of reflexes.
Syringomyelia has Symptom: Loss of sensitivity to pain and temperature.
Syringomyelia has Symptom: Headaches.
Syringomyelia has Symptom: Stiffness in the back, shoulders, arms and legs.
Syringomyelia has Symptom: Pain in the neck, arms and back.
Syringomyelia has Symptom: Scoliosis. This is when the spine curves sideways.
Syringomyelia has Cause: Chiari malformation, a condition in which brain tissue pushes into the spinal canal and blocks the regular flow of cerebrospinal fluid.
Syringomyelia has Cause: Meningitis, which is swelling of the membranes surrounding the brain and spinal cord.
Syringomyelia has Cause: Spinal cord tumor, which can interfere with the regular flow of cerebrospinal fluid.
Syringomyelia has Cause: Conditions present at birth, such as a tethered spinal cord. A tethered spinal cord is a condition caused when tissue attached to the spinal cord limits its movement.
Syringomyelia has Cause: Spinal cord injury, which can cause symptoms months or years later.
Syringomyelia has Complication: Scoliosis. This is when the spine curves sideways.
Syringomyelia has Complication: Chronic pain resulting from damage to the spinal cord.
Syringomyelia has Complication: Motor difficulties that can affect walking. Examples include weakness and stiffness in the leg muscles.
Syringomyelia has Complication: Paralysis.
Systemic mastocytosis has Symptom: Flushing, itching or hives
Systemic mastocytosis has Symptom: Abdominal pain, diarrhea, nausea or vomiting
Systemic mastocytosis has Symptom: Anemia or bleeding disorders
Systemic mastocytosis has Symptom: Bone and muscle pain
Systemic mastocytosis has Symptom: Enlarged liver, spleen or lymph nodes
Systemic mastocytosis has Symptom: Depression, mood changes or problems concentrating

Systemic mastocytosis has Cause: Most cases of systemic mastocytosis are caused by a random change (mutation) in the KIT gene. Typically this flaw in the KIT gene is not inherited. Too many mast cells are produced and build up in tissues and body organs, releasing substances such as histamine, leukotrienes and cytokines that cause inflammation and symptoms.
Systemic mastocytosis has Complication: Anaphylactic reaction.
Systemic mastocytosis has Complication: Blood disorders.
Systemic mastocytosis has Complication: Peptic ulcer disease.
Systemic mastocytosis has Complication: Reduced bone density.
Systemic mastocytosis has Complication: Organ failure.
Tachycardia has Symptom: Racing, pounding heartbeat or flopping in the chest, called palpitations.
Tachycardia has Symptom: Chest pain.
Tachycardia has Symptom: Fainting.
Tachycardia has Symptom: Lightheadedness.
Tachycardia has Symptom: Rapid pulse.
Tachycardia has Symptom: Shortness of breath.
Tachycardia has Cause: Fever.
Tachycardia has Cause: Excessive alcohol use, which is defined as 14 or more drinks a week for a man or seven or more drinks a week for a woman.
Tachycardia has Cause: Alcohol withdrawal.
Tachycardia has Cause: Too much caffeine.
Tachycardia has Cause: High or low blood pressure.
Tachycardia has Cause: Changes in the level of minerals in the body, called electrolytes. Examples include potassium, sodium, calcium and magnesium.
Tachycardia has Cause: Certain medicines.
Tachycardia has Cause: Overactive thyroid, called hyperthyroidism.
Tachycardia has Cause: A low number of red blood cells, called anemia.
Tachycardia has Cause: Smoking or nicotine use.
Tachycardia has Cause: Use of illegal stimulants such as cocaine or methamphetamine.
Tachycardia has Cause: Heart attack.
Tachycardia has Risk Factor: Getting older.
Tachycardia has Risk Factor: Having a family history of some heart rhythm disorders.
Tachycardia has Risk Factor: High blood pressure.
Tachycardia has Complication: The type of tachycardia.
Tachycardia has Complication: How fast the heart is beating.
Tachycardia has Complication: How long the rapid heart rate lasts.
Tachycardia has Complication: Whether there are other heart conditions.
Tachycardia has Preventio: Don't smoke.
Tachycardia has Preventio: Eat a diet that's low in salt and saturated fat.
Tachycardia has Preventio: Exercise at least 30 minutes a day on most days of the week.
Tachycardia has Preventio: Maintain a healthy weight.
Tachycardia has Preventio: Reduce and manage stress.
Tachycardia has Preventio: Control high blood pressure, high cholesterol and diabetes.
Tachycardia has Preventio: Get good sleep. Adults should aim for 7 to 9 hours daily.
Takayasu's arteritis has Symptom: The symptoms of Takayasu arteritis often come in two stages.

Takayasu's arteritis has Cause: No one knows exactly what causes the first swelling, called inflammation, in Takayasu arteritis. It's likely an autoimmune condition. This means the immune system attacks the arteries by mistake. A virus or other infection may set off the condition.
Takayasu's arteritis has Risk Factor: Takayasu arteritis mainly affects people assigned female at birth who are younger than 40. The condition happens around the world. But it's most common in Asia.
Takayasu's arteritis has Complication: With Takayasu arteritis, cycles of swelling and healing in the arteries might lead to one or more of these complications:
Tapeworm infection has Symptom: Symptoms depend mostly on where the infection happens in the body.

Tapeworm infection has Cause: Most tapeworms need two different hosts to complete a life cycle. One host is the place where a parasite grows from egg to larva, called the intermediate host. The other host is where the larva become adults, called the definitive host. For example, beef tapeworms need cattle and humans to go through a complete life cycle.
Tapeworm infection has Risk Factor: Eating raw or undercooked meats.
Tapeworm infection has Risk Factor: Poor hygiene.

Tapeworm infection has Risk Factor: Lack of sanitation and sewage for human waste increases the risk of livestock getting tapeworm eggs from people. This increases the risk of people eating infected meat.
Tapeworm infection has Risk Factor: Lack of clean water.
Tapeworm infection has Risk Factor: High-risk regions.
Tapeworm infection has Complication: Tapeworm infections usually don't cause complications. Problems that may happen include:
Tapeworm infection has Preventio: Wash your hands.
Tapeworm infection has Preventio: Wash fruits and vegetables.
Tapeworm infection has Preventio: Wash kitchen utensils well.
Tapeworm infection has Preventio: Don't eat raw or undercooked meat or fish.
Tapeworm infection has Preventio: Freeze meat.
Tapeworm infection has Preventio: Treat infected dogs.
Tay-Sachs disease has Symptom: There are three forms of Tay-Sachs disease: infantile, juvenile and late onset/adult.

Tay-Sachs disease has Cause: Tay-Sachs disease is a genetic disorder that is passed from parents to their children. It occurs when a child inherits a flaw (mutation) in the HEXA gene from both parents.
Tay-Sachs disease has Risk Factor: Eastern and Central European Jewish communities (Ashkenazi Jews)
Tay-Sachs disease has Risk Factor: Certain French Canadian communities in Quebec
Tay-Sachs disease has Risk Factor: Cajun community of Louisiana
Tay-Sachs disease has Risk Factor: Old Order Amish community in Pennsylvania
T-cell lymphoma has Symptom: Swollen lymph nodes in the neck, armpit and groin.
T-cell lymphoma has Symptom: Fever.
T-cell lymphoma has Symptom: Drenching night sweats.
T-cell lymphoma has Symptom: Fatigue.
T-cell lymphoma has Symptom: Weight loss without trying.
T-cell lymphoma has Symptom: Loss of appetite.

T-cell lymphoma has Cause: It's not clear what causes T-cell lymphomas. Cancer happens when cells develop changes in their DNA. A cell's DNA holds the instructions that tell the cell what to do. In healthy cells, the DNA gives instructions to grow and multiply at a set rate. The instructions tell the cells to die at a set time. In cancer cells, the DNA changes give different instructions. The changes tell the cancer cells to make many more cells quickly. Cancer cells can keep living when healthy cells would die. This causes too many cells.
T-cell lymphoma has Risk Factor: A family history of lymphoma.
T-cell lymphoma has Risk Factor: A weakened immune system or an autoimmune condition.
T-cell lymphoma has Risk Factor: Some infections.

T-cell lymphoma has Complication: A complication of T-cell lymphomas is the risk of the cancer coming back after treatment, called a relapse. Sometimes the relapse happens years later. Some people may have multiple relapses. People who relapse have a worse prognosis.

Teen depression has Symptom: Teen depression signs and symptoms include a change from the teenager's previous attitude and behavior that can cause significant distress and problems at school or home, in social activities, or in other areas of life.
Teen depression has Cause: Brain chemistry.
Teen depression has Cause: Hormones.
Teen depression has Cause: Inherited traits.
Teen depression has Cause: Early childhood trauma.
Teen depression has Cause: Learned patterns of negative thinking.
Teen depression has Risk Factor: Having issues that negatively impact self-esteem, such as obesity, peer problems, long-term bullying or academic problems
Teen depression has Risk Factor: Having been the victim or witness of violence, such as physical or sexual abuse
Teen depression has Risk Factor: Having other mental health conditions, such as bipolar disorder, an anxiety disorder, a personality disorder, anorexia or bulimia
Teen depression has Risk Factor: Having a learning disability or attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD)
Teen depression has Risk Factor: Having ongoing pain or a chronic physical illness such as cancer, diabetes or asthma
Teen depression has Risk Factor: Having certain personality traits, such as low self-esteem or being overly dependent, self-critical or pessimistic
Teen depression has Risk Factor: Abusing alcohol, nicotine or other drugs
Teen depression has Risk Factor: Being gay, lesbian, bisexual or transgender in an unsupportive environment
Teen depression has Complication: Alcohol and drug misuse
Teen depression has Complication: Academic problems
Teen depression has Complication: Family conflicts and relationship difficulties
Teen depression has Complication: Suicide attempts or suicide
Teen depression has Preventio: Take steps to control stress,
Teen depression has Preventio: Practice self-care,
Teen depression has Preventio: Reach out for friendship and social support,
Teen depression has Preventio: Get treatment at the earliest sign of a problem
Teen depression has Preventio: Maintain ongoing treatment, if recommended,
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Symptom: Teeth grinding or clenching, which may be loud enough to wake up your sleep partner.
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Symptom: Teeth that are flattened, fractured, chipped or loose.
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Symptom: Worn tooth enamel. This can expose the inner layers of your teeth.
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Symptom: Tooth pain or sensitivity.
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Symptom: Tired or tight jaw muscles, or a locked jaw that won't open or close all the way. Your jaw may pop and click.
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Symptom: Jaw, neck or face pain or soreness.
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Symptom: Jaw muscles that are larger than expected.
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Symptom: Pain that feels like an earache, though it's not really a problem with your ear.
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Symptom: Dull headache starting at your temples — the sides of your head between your forehead and ears.
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Symptom: Sleep problems.
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Cause: Awake bruxism
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Cause: Sleep bruxism
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Risk Factor: Stress.
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Risk Factor: Bruxism is common in young children, but it usually goes away by adulthood.
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Risk Factor: Personality type.
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Risk Factor: Awake time mouth habits.
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Risk Factor: Medicines and other substances.
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Risk Factor: Family members with bruxism.
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Risk Factor: Other conditions.
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Complication: Damage to your teeth or jaws and to fillings, crowns or other dental repairs.
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Complication: Tension-type headaches.
Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Complication: Severe facial or jaw pain.

Teeth grinding (bruxism) has Complication: Conditions that occur in the temporomandibular joints (TMJs). These are jaw joints just in front of your ears. TMJ problems can cause pain and may sound like clicking when you open and close your mouth.
Temporal lobe seizure has Symptom: A sudden sense of fear or joy.
Temporal lobe seizure has Symptom: A feeling that what's happening has happened before, known as deja vu.
Temporal lobe seizure has Symptom: A sudden or strange odor or taste.
Temporal lobe seizure has Symptom: A rising feeling in the belly that feels like being on a roller coaster

Tendinitis has Cause: Tendinitis can be caused by a sudden injury. But repeating the same movement over time is a much more likely cause. Most people develop tendinitis because their jobs or hobbies involve motions that they repeat, over and over. This puts stress on tendons.

Tendinitis has Risk Factor: Risk factors for developing tendinitis include age, having jobs that involve doing the same motion over and over, doing physical activities with poor form, and taking certain medicines.
Tendinitis has Complication: Without treatment, tendinitis can increase the risk of a tendon breaking down or tearing. A completely torn tendon might need surgery.

Tendinopathy has Cause: Tendinopathy can be caused by wear and tear on a tendon. This can happen due to overuse or naturally over time as people age and their tendons become less flexible. Most people develop tendinopathy because their jobs or hobbies involve motions they repeat over and over. Jobs such as carpentry or house painting or sports such as baseball, tennis and golf require the same motions to be repeated. Over time, this puts stress on the tendons. Some tendinopathies also can be caused by sudden injury such as a fall or accident.

Tendinopathy has Risk Factor: Risk factors for developing tendinopathy include older age and having jobs or hobbies that involve doing the same motion over and over. Some medical conditions and certain medicines also may increase the risk.

Tension headache has Cause: The cause of tension-type headaches is not known. In the past, experts thought tension-type headaches were caused by muscle contractions in the face, neck and scalp. They thought the muscle contractions were a result of emotions, tension or stress. But research suggests that muscle contraction isn't the cause.

Tension headache has Risk Factor: Most people experience a tension-type headache at some point in their lives. However, some research has found that women are more likely to have frequent episodic tension-type headaches and chronic tension-type headaches. Age also might play a factor. One study found that episodic tension-type headaches were more likely to affect people in their 40s.

Tension headache has Complication: Because tension-type headaches are so common, they can have an effect on job productivity and quality of life, particularly if they're chronic. Frequent headache pain may make it hard to attend activities. You might need to stay home from work. If you do go to your job, it may be hard to function as usual.

Thrombocytosis has Cause: Bone marrow is a spongy tissue inside your bones. It contains stem cells that can become red blood cells, white blood cells or platelets. Platelets stick together, helping blood to form a clot that stops bleeding when you damage a blood vessel, such as when you cut yourself. Thrombocytosis occurs when your body produces too many platelets.

Thrombocytosis has Complication: Heart attacks.

Thrombophlebitis has Symptom: Symptoms of superficial thrombophlebitis include warmth, tenderness, and pain. You might have redness and swelling and see a red, hard cord just under the surface of your skin that's tender to the touch. Symptoms of deep vein thrombosis include swelling, tenderness, and pain in your leg.

Thrombophlebitis has Cause: Thrombophlebitis is caused by a blood clot. A blood clot can form because of an injury to a vein or from having an inherited disorder that affects how your blood clots. You may also get a blood clot after not being active for long periods of time, like during a hospital stay or recovery from an injury.

Thrombophlebitis has Risk Factor: Your risk of thrombophlebitis is higher if you're not active for a long period or you have a catheter in a central vein to treat a condition. Having varicose veins or a pacemaker can also increase your risk. Women who are pregnant, have just given birth, or take birth control pills or hormone replacement therapy may also be at higher risk. Other risk factors include a family history of a blood-clotting disorder, a tendency to form blood clots, and having thrombophlebitis before. Your risk may also be higher if you've had a stroke, you're over age 60, or you're overweight. Having cancer and smoking are also risk factors.

Thrombophlebitis has Complication: Complications from superficial thrombophlebitis are rare. However, if you develop deep vein thrombosis (DVT), the risk of serious complications increases. Complications might include:
Thrombophlebitis has Preventio: Sitting during a long flight or car ride can cause your ankles and calves to swell and increases your risk of thrombophlebitis. To help prevent a blood clot:

Thyroid cancer has Cause: Thyroid cancer happens when cells in the thyroid develop changes in their DNA. A cell's DNA contains the instructions that tell the cell what to do. The changes, which doctors call mutations, tell the cells to grow and multiply rapidly. The cells go on living when healthy cells would naturally die. The accumulating cells form a mass called a tumor.

Thyroid cancer has Risk Factor: Thyroid cancer occurs more often in women than in men. Experts think it may be related to the hormone estrogen. People who are assigned female sex at birth generally have higher levels of estrogen in their bodies.
Thyroid cancer has Risk Factor: Exposure to high levels of radiation.
Thyroid cancer has Risk Factor: Certain inherited genetic syndromes.

Thyroid cancer has Complication: Thyroid cancer can return despite successful treatment, and it can even come back if you've had your thyroid removed. This could happen if cancer cells spread beyond the thyroid before it's removed.

Thyroid cancer has Preventio: Doctors aren't sure what causes the gene changes that lead to most thyroid cancers, so there's no way to prevent thyroid cancer in people who have an average risk of the disease.

Tongue cancer has Cause: Tongue cancer starts when healthy cells in the tongue develop changes in their DNA. A cell's DNA contains the instructions that tell the cell what to do. The changes tell the cells to grow out of control and to continue living when healthy cells would die as part of their natural life cycle. This makes a lot of extra cells. The cells can form a growth, called a tumor. In time, the cells can break away and spread to other areas of the body.

Tonsil cancer has Cause: Tonsil cancer happens when cells in the tonsils develop changes in their DNA. A cell's DNA holds the instructions that tell a cell what to do. In healthy cells, the DNA gives instructions to grow and multiply at a set rate. The instructions tell the cells to die at a set time. In cancer cells, the changes give different instructions. The changes tell the cancer cells to make many more cells quickly. Cancer cells can keep living when healthy cells would die. This causes too many cells.

Tooth abscess has Cause: A periapical tooth abscess occurs when bacteria invade the dental pulp. The pulp is the innermost part of the tooth that contains blood vessels, nerves and connective tissue.
Tooth abscess has Risk Factor: These factors may increase your risk of a tooth abscess:

Tooth abscess has Complication: A tooth abscess won't go away without treatment. If the abscess ruptures, the pain may improve a lot, making you think that the problem has gone away — but you still need to get dental treatment.
Tooth abscess has Preventio: Avoiding tooth decay is essential to preventing a tooth abscess. Take good care of your teeth to avoid tooth decay:

Torn meniscus has Symptom: If you've torn your meniscus, it might take 24 hours or more for pain and swelling to begin, especially if the tear is small. You might develop the following signs and symptoms in your knee:

Torn meniscus has Cause: A torn meniscus can result from any activity that causes you to forcefully twist or rotate your knee, such as aggressive pivoting or sudden stops and turns. Even kneeling, deep squatting or lifting something heavy can sometimes lead to a torn meniscus.

Torn meniscus has Risk Factor: Performing activities that involve aggressive twisting and pivoting of the knee puts you at risk of a torn meniscus. The risk is particularly high for athletes — especially those who participate in contact sports, such as football, or activities that involve pivoting, such as tennis or basketball.

Torn meniscus has Complication: A torn meniscus can lead to a feeling of your knee giving way, inability to move your knee as you usually do or persistent knee pain. You might be more likely to develop osteoarthritis in the injured knee.

Tourette syndrome has Symptom: Complex tics.

Chemicals in the brain that transmit nerve impulses (neurotransmitters), including dopamine and serotonin, might play a role.

Toxic hepatitis has Complication: The swelling, called inflammation, of toxic hepatitis can lead to liver damage and scarring. Over time, this scarring, called cirrhosis, makes it hard for the liver to do its job.

Toxic hepatitis has Preventio: Take medicines only as directed.

Toxic shock syndrome has Risk Factor: Toxic shock syndrome can affect anyone. About half the cases of toxic shock syndrome linked to staph bacteria happen to people who menstruate. Strep toxic shock syndrome happens to people of all ages.
Toxic shock syndrome has Complication: Toxic shock syndrome can progress rapidly. Complications may include:

Toxic shock syndrome has Preventio: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration reviews tampons for safety and how well they work. They're also tested to see if they help harmful bacteria, which can cause toxic shock syndrome, grow.

Tracheomalacia has Symptom: Noisy breathing, such as high-pitched wheezing or rattling sounds.

Trachoma has Symptom: Eye discharge containing mucus or pus
Trachoma has Symptom: Eyelid swelling

Trachoma has Risk Factor: Crowded living conditions.
Trachoma has Risk Factor: Poor sanitation.
Trachoma has Risk Factor: In areas where the disease is active, it's most common in children ages 4 to 6.

Trachoma has Risk Factor: In some areas, women's rate of contracting the disease is two to six times higher than that of men. This may be attributed to the fact that women have more contact with children, who are the primary reservoir of infection.
Trachoma has Risk Factor: Flies.

Trachoma has Complication: Eyelid deformities, such as an inward-folding eyelid (entropion) or ingrown eyelashes (trichiasis), which can scratch the cornea

Transient global amnesia has Symptom: The main symptom of transient global amnesia is being unable to create new memories and remember the recent past. Once that symptom is confirmed, ruling out other possible causes of amnesia is important.

Transient global amnesia has Cause: The underlying cause of transient global amnesia is unknown. There may be a link between transient global amnesia and a history of migraines. But experts don't understand the factors that contribute to both conditions. Another possible cause is the overfilling of veins with blood due to some sort of blockage or other problem with the flow of blood (venous congestion).

Transient global amnesia has Risk Factor: Interestingly, many studies have found that high blood pressure and high cholesterol — which are closely linked to strokes — are not risk factors for transient global amnesia. This is probably because transient global amnesia doesn't represent blood vessel diseases of aging. Your sex doesn't seem to affect your risk, either.

Transient global amnesia has Complication: Transient global amnesia has no direct complications. It's not a risk factor for stroke or epilepsy. It's possible to have a second episode of transient global amnesia, but it's extremely rare to have more than two.
Transient global amnesia has Preventio: Because the cause of transient global amnesia is unknown and the rate of recurrence is low, there's no real way to prevent the condition.
Transient ischemic attack (TIA) has Symptom: Weakness, numbness or paralysis in the face, arm or leg, typically on one side of the body.
Transient ischemic attack (TIA) has Symptom: Slurred speech or trouble understanding others.
Transient ischemic attack (TIA) has Symptom: Blindness in one or both eyes or double vision.
Transient ischemic attack (TIA) has Symptom: Dizziness or loss of balance or coordination.

Transient ischemic attack (TIA) has Cause: The cause of a transient ischemic attack is similar to the cause of an ischemic stroke, which is the most common type of stroke. In an ischemic stroke, a blood clot blocks the blood supply to part of the brain. In aTIA, unlike a stroke, the blockage is brief and there is no permanent damage.
Transient ischemic attack (TIA) has Risk Factor: Some risk factors of a transient ischemic attack and stroke can't be changed. Others you can control.
Transient ischemic attack (TIA) has Preventio: Don't smoke.
Transient ischemic attack (TIA) has Preventio: Limit cholesterol and fat.

Transient ischemic attack (TIA) has Preventio: Don't use illicit drugs.
Transient ischemic attack (TIA) has Preventio: Control diabetes.

Traumatic brain injury has Symptom: Traumatic brain injury can have wide-ranging physical and psychological effects. Some signs or symptoms may appear immediately after the traumatic event, while others may appear days or weeks later.

Traumatic brain injury has Cause: Traumatic brain injury is usually caused by a blow or other traumatic injury to the head or body. The degree of damage can depend on several factors, including the nature of the injury and the force of impact.
Traumatic brain injury has Risk Factor: The people most at risk of traumatic brain injury include:

Traumatic brain injury has Complication: Several complications can occur immediately or soon after a traumatic brain injury. Severe injuries increase the risk of a greater number of and more-severe complications.
Traumatic brain injury has Preventio: Follow these tips to reduce the risk of brain injury:
Traveler's diarrhea has Symptom: Suddenly passing three or more looser watery stools a day.
Traveler's diarrhea has Symptom: An urgent need to pass stool.
Traveler's diarrhea has Symptom: Stomach cramps.
Traveler's diarrhea has Symptom: Nausea.
Traveler's diarrhea has Symptom: Vomiting.
Traveler's diarrhea has Symptom: Fever.

Traveler's diarrhea has Cause: It's possible that traveler's diarrhea may stem from the stress of traveling or a change in diet. But usually infectious agents — such as bacteria, viruses or parasites — are to blame. You typically develop traveler's diarrhea after ingesting food or water contaminated with organisms from feces.
Traveler's diarrhea has Risk Factor: Central America.
Traveler's diarrhea has Risk Factor: South America.
Traveler's diarrhea has Risk Factor: Mexico.
Traveler's diarrhea has Risk Factor: Africa.
Traveler's diarrhea has Risk Factor: South Asia and Southeast Asia.

Traveler's diarrhea has Complication: Because you lose vital fluids, salts and minerals during a bout with traveler's diarrhea, you may become dehydrated, especially during the summer months. Dehydration is especially dangerous for children, older adults and people with weakened immune systems.

Traveler's diarrhea has Preventio: The general rule of thumb when traveling to another country is this: Boil it, cook it, peel it or forget it. But it's still possible to get sick even if you follow these rules.

Trichinosis has Symptom: Symptoms of trichinosis infection and how bad they are can vary. They depend on the number of larvae eaten in the infected meat. Symptoms can happen with a larger number of parasites in the body. Symptoms sometimes get worse as the roundworm larvae travel through the body.

Trichinosis has Cause: People get trichinosis when they eat raw or undercooked meat that is infected with the larvae of a trichinella roundworm parasite. You can't get the infection from another person or give it to another person.

Trichinosis has Risk Factor: Eating raw or undercooked food is the main risk factor for trichinosis. Food also can be infected by grinders or other equipment. The risk may be higher for people who eat meat from wild animals. Trichinosis risk also may be higher from animals raised and processed outside of a commercial facility.

Trichinosis has Complication: Complications linked to trichinosis are rare. But if many roundworm larvae move through the body to muscle tissue in and around organs, this may cause harmful complications. Some complications may be fatal.
Trichinosis has Preventio: The best way to prevent trichinosis is to cook food well. Follow these tips:

Trichomoniasis has Cause: Trichomoniasis is caused by a tiny parasite called Trichomonas vaginalis. The parasite passes between people during genital contact, including vaginal, oral or anal sex. The parasite often passes from a penis to a vagina, or from a vagina to a penis. It also can pass from a vagina to another vagina.
Trichomoniasis has Risk Factor: Risk factors for trichomoniasis include having:
Trichomoniasis has Complication: Pregnant people who have trichomoniasis might:
Trichomoniasis has Preventio: You can prevent trichomoniasis by not having sex. Or if you're sexually active, you can take the following steps to lower your risk:

Trichotillomania (hair-pulling disorder) has Symptom: Repeatedly pulling out your hair, whether it's automatic or on purpose, usually from your scalp, eyebrows or eyelashes, but sometimes from other body areas. The sites may vary over time.
Trichotillomania (hair-pulling disorder) has Symptom: An increasing sense of tension before pulling out your hair, or when you try to resist pulling.
Trichotillomania (hair-pulling disorder) has Symptom: A sense of pleasure or relief after the hair is pulled out.

Trichotillomania (hair-pulling disorder) has Symptom: Hair loss that's easy to see, such as shortened hair or thinned or bald areas on the scalp or other areas of your body. This may include thin or missing eyelashes or eyebrows.
Trichotillomania (hair-pulling disorder) has Symptom: Pulling out specific types of hair, taking the same steps in the same way each time hair is pulled out or pulling out hair in certain patterns.
Trichotillomania (hair-pulling disorder) has Symptom: Biting, chewing or eating pulled-out hair.
Trichotillomania (hair-pulling disorder) has Symptom: Playing with pulled-out hair or rubbing it across your lips or face.
Trichotillomania (hair-pulling disorder) has Symptom: Repeatedly trying to stop pulling out your hair or trying to do it less often without success.
Trichotillomania (hair-pulling disorder) has Symptom: Experiencing a great deal of distress or problems at work, school or in social situations related to pulling out your hair.

Trichotillomania (hair-pulling disorder) has Cause: The cause of trichotillomania is not clear. But like many complex disorders, trichotillomania likely results from a combination of genetic and learned factors.
Trichotillomania (hair-pulling disorder) has Risk Factor: Family history.
Trichotillomania (hair-pulling disorder) has Risk Factor: Health conditions.

Trichotillomania (hair-pulling disorder) has Risk Factor: Trichotillomania usually develops just before or during the early teens — most often between the ages of 10 and 13 years. It's often a lifelong problem. Babies may pull out their hair, but this is usually mild and goes away on its own without treatment.
Trichotillomania (hair-pulling disorder) has Risk Factor: Other mental health conditions.

Trichotillomania (hair-pulling disorder) has Complication: Hairballs.
Tricuspid atresia has Symptom: Tricuspid atresia symptoms are usually seen soon after birth. Symptoms of tricuspid atresia may include:

Tricuspid atresia has Cause: Most congenital heart defects, including tricuspid atresia, result from changes that occur early as the baby's heart is developing before birth. The exact cause is usually unknown.

Tricuspid atresia has Risk Factor: It's not entirely clear why congenital heart defects such as tricuspid atresia occur. But some risk factors have been identified. Many babies born with a genetic disorder called Down syndrome have tricuspid atresia.

Tricuspid atresia has Complication: Tricuspid atresia restricts blood flow from the heart to the lungs. The right lower heart chamber is small and underdeveloped. A life-threatening complication of tricuspid atresia is a lack of oxygen to the body's tissues. This condition is called hypoxemia.
Tricuspid atresia has Preventio: Because the exact cause of most congenital heart defects is unknown, it may not be possible to prevent tricuspid atresia.
Tricuspid valve disease has Symptom: A fast, pounding heartbeat.
Tricuspid valve disease has Symptom: Fluttering feeling in the neck.
Tricuspid valve disease has Symptom: Fatigue.
Tricuspid valve disease has Cause: Aortic valve.
Tricuspid valve disease has Cause: Mitral valve.
Tricuspid valve disease has Cause: Pulmonary valve.
Tricuspid valve disease has Cause: Tricuspid valve.
Tricuspid valve disease has Risk Factor: Risk factors for tricuspid valve disease depend on the specific condition.
Tricuspid valve regurgitation has Symptom: Extreme tiredness.
Tricuspid valve regurgitation has Symptom: Shortness of breath with activity.
Tricuspid valve regurgitation has Symptom: Feelings of a rapid or pounding heartbeat.
Tricuspid valve regurgitation has Symptom: Pounding or pulsing feeling in the neck.

Tricuspid valve regurgitation has Complication: An irregular and often rapid heartbeat, called atrial fibrillation (AFib).

Trigeminal neuralgia has Symptom: Episodes of intense shooting or jabbing pain that may feel like an electric shock.
Trigeminal neuralgia has Symptom: Sudden episodes of pain or pain triggered by touching the face, chewing, speaking or brushing your teeth.
Trigeminal neuralgia has Symptom: Episodes of pain lasting from a few seconds to several minutes.
Trigeminal neuralgia has Symptom: Pain that occurs with facial spasms.
Trigeminal neuralgia has Symptom: Episodes of pain lasting days, weeks, months or longer. Some people have periods when they experience no pain.
Trigeminal neuralgia has Symptom: Pain in areas supplied by the trigeminal nerve. These areas include the cheek, jaw, teeth, gums or lips. Less often, the eye and forehead may be affected.
Trigeminal neuralgia has Symptom: Pain on one side of the face at a time.
Trigeminal neuralgia has Symptom: Pain focused in one spot. Or the pain may be spread in a wider pattern.
Trigeminal neuralgia has Symptom: Pain that rarely occurs while sleeping.
Trigeminal neuralgia has Symptom: Episodes of pain that become more frequent and intense over time.

Trigeminal neuralgia has Cause: In trigeminal neuralgia, the trigeminal nerve's function is disrupted. Contact between a blood vessel and the trigeminal nerve at the base of the brain often causes the pain. The blood vessel may be an artery or a vein. This contact puts pressure on the nerve and doesn't allow it to function as usual.
Trigeminal neuralgia has Risk Factor: Women are more likely than men to experience trigeminal neuralgia.
Trigeminal neuralgia has Risk Factor: Trigeminal neuralgia is more common among people 50 and older.
Trigeminal neuralgia has Risk Factor: Certain conditions.
Trigger finger has Symptom: Finger stiffness, particularly in the morning.
Trigger finger has Symptom: A popping or clicking sensation as the finger moves.
Trigger finger has Symptom: Tenderness or a bump in the palm at the base of the affected finger.
Trigger finger has Symptom: Finger catching or locking in a bent position, which suddenly pops straight.
Trigger finger has Symptom: Finger locked in a bent position.

Trigger finger has Cause: Tendons are tough cords that attach muscle to bone. Each tendon is surrounded by a protective sheath. Trigger finger occurs when the affected finger's tendon sheath becomes irritated and swollen. This makes it harder for the tendon to glide through the sheath.
Trigger finger has Risk Factor: Repeated gripping.
Trigger finger has Risk Factor: Certain health problems.
Trigger finger has Risk Factor: Trigger finger is more common in women.
Trigger finger has Complication: Trigger finger can make it harder to type, button a shirt or insert a key into a lock. It also can affect your ability to grip a steering wheel or grasp tools.
Triple X syndrome has Symptom: Signs and symptoms can vary greatly among girls and women with triple X syndrome. Many experience no noticeable effects or have only mild symptoms.
Triple X syndrome has Cause: Although triple X syndrome is genetic, it's usually not inherited — it's due to a random genetic error.

Triple X syndrome has Risk Factor: There are no major risk factors for Triple X syndrome. Most cases are due to a random error in the division of cells in the mother's egg, the father's sperm or when the embryo is developing.

Triple X syndrome has Complication: Although some females may have mild or no symptoms associated with triple X syndrome, others experience developmental, psychological and behavioral problems that may lead to a variety of other issues, including:
Truncus arteriosus has Symptom: Blue or gray skin due to low oxygen levels.
Truncus arteriosus has Symptom: Extreme sleepiness.
Truncus arteriosus has Symptom: Poor feeding.
Truncus arteriosus has Symptom: Poor growth.
Truncus arteriosus has Symptom: Pounding heartbeat.
Truncus arteriosus has Symptom: Fast breathing.
Truncus arteriosus has Symptom: Shortness of breath.
Truncus arteriosus has Cause: Truncus arteriosus occurs as a baby's heart forms during pregnancy. There's often no clear cause. Genetics and environmental factors may play a role.
Truncus arteriosus has Risk Factor: Viral illness during pregnancy.
Truncus arteriosus has Risk Factor: Poorly controlled diabetes during pregnancy.
Truncus arteriosus has Risk Factor: Some medicines taken during pregnancy.
Truncus arteriosus has Risk Factor: Some chromosomal disorders.
Truncus arteriosus has Risk Factor: Smoking during pregnancy.
Truncus arteriosus has Risk Factor: Alcohol use.
Truncus arteriosus has Risk Factor: Obesity.
Truncus arteriosus has Complication: Breathing problems.
Truncus arteriosus has Complication: High blood pressure in the lungs, also called pulmonary hypertension.
Truncus arteriosus has Complication: Enlargement of the heart.
Truncus arteriosus has Complication: Heart failure.
Truncus arteriosus has Preventio: Get recommended vaccinations.
Truncus arteriosus has Preventio: Talk to your healthcare professional about your medicines.
Truncus arteriosus has Preventio: Take a folic acid supplement.
Truncus arteriosus has Preventio: Control diabetes.
Tuberculosis has Symptom: When TB germs survive and multiply in the lungs, it is called a TB infection. A TB infection may be in one of three stages. Symptoms are different in each stage.
Tuberculosis has Cause: Tuberculosis is caused by a bacterium called Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
Tuberculosis has Risk Factor: Anyone can get tuberculosis, but certain factors increase the risk of getting an infection. Other factors increase the risk of an infection becoming active TB disease.
Tuberculosis has Preventio: If you test positive for latent TB infection, you may need to take medicines to prevent active TB disease.

Tuberous sclerosis has Cause: Tuberous sclerosis is a genetic disorder caused by gene changes — sometimes called mutations — in either theTSC1or theTSC2gene. These genes are thought to prevent cells from growing too fast or in an out-of-control way. Changes in either of these genes can cause cells to grow and divide more than needed. This leads to multiple growths throughout the body. These growths are considered noncancerous tumors.
Tuberous sclerosis has Risk Factor: A random cell division error.
Tuberous sclerosis has Risk Factor: A gene change passed down in families.

Turner syndrome has Symptom: Signs and symptoms of Turner syndrome may vary among girls and women with the disorder. For some girls, the presence of Turner syndrome may not be readily apparent, but in other girls, several physical features are apparent early. Signs and symptoms can be subtle, developing slowly over time, or significant, such as heart defects.

Turner syndrome has Cause: Most people are born with two sex chromosomes. Males inherit the X chromosome from their mothers and the Y chromosome from their fathers. Females inherit one X chromosome from each parent. In females who have Turner syndrome, one copy of the X chromosome is missing, partially missing or changed.

Turner syndrome has Risk Factor: The loss or alteration of the X chromosome occurs randomly. Sometimes, it's because of a problem with the sperm or the egg, and other times, the loss or alteration of the X chromosome happens early in fetal development.

Turner syndrome has Complication: Turner syndrome can affect the proper development of several body systems, but this varies greatly among individuals with the syndrome. Complications that can occur include:

Typhoid fever has Symptom: Symptoms are likely to start slowly, often showing up 1 to 3 weeks after contact with the bacteria.

Typhoid fever has Cause: A strain of bacteria called Salmonella enterica serotype typhi causes typhoid fever. People who have typhoid fever or the bacteria in their body can shed the bacteria in their stool.

Typhoid fever has Risk Factor: Typhoid fever is a serious worldwide threat, especially to children. Africa and South Asia have the highest number of infections as well as regular outbreaks. But typhoid fever happens around the world, often spreading through travelers to and from high-risk areas.

Umbilical hernia has Symptom: An umbilical hernia creates a soft swelling or bulge near the navel. In babies who have an umbilical hernia, the bulge may be visible only when they cry, cough or strain.

Umbilical hernia has Cause: During gestation, the umbilical cord passes through a small opening in the baby's abdominal muscles. The opening normally closes just after birth. If the muscles don't join together completely in the midline of the abdominal wall, an umbilical hernia may appear at birth or later in life.

Umbilical hernia has Risk Factor: Umbilical hernias are most common in infants — especially premature babies and those with low birth weights. In the United States, black infants appear to have a slightly increased risk of umbilical hernias. The condition affects boys and girls equally.

Umbilical hernia has Complication: For children, complications of an umbilical hernia are rare. Complications can occur when the protruding abdominal tissue becomes trapped (incarcerated) and can no longer be pushed back into the abdominal cavity. This reduces the blood supply to the section of trapped intestine and can lead to abdominal pain and tissue damage.
Undescended testicle has Symptom: Not seeing or feeling a testicle in the scrotum is the main symptom of an undescended testicle.

Undescended testicle has Cause: The exact cause of an undescended testicle isn't known. Genes, the health of the baby's mother and other factors might have a combined effect. Together they may disrupt the hormones, physical changes and nerve activity that play roles in how the testicles develop.

Undescended testicle has Risk Factor: Family history of undescended testicles.

Uterine fibroids has Complication: Uterine fibroids often aren't dangerous. But they can cause pain, and they may lead to complications. These include a drop in red blood cells called anemia. That condition can cause fatigue from heavy blood loss. If you bleed heavily during your period, your doctor may tell you to take an iron supplement to prevent or help manage anemia. Sometimes, a person with anemia needs to receive blood from a donor, called a transfusion, due to blood loss.

Vaginal cancer has Cause: Vaginal cancer begins when cells in the vagina develop changes in their DNA. A cell's DNA holds the instructions that tell a cell what to do. In healthy cells, the DNA gives instructions to grow and multiply at a set rate. The instructions tell the cells to die at a set time. In cancer cells, the DNA changes give different instructions. The changes tell the cancer cells to make many more cells quickly. Cancer cells can keep living when healthy cells would die. This causes too many cells.

Vaginal cancer has Complication: Vaginal cancer can spread to other parts of the body. It most often spreads to the lungs, liver and bones. When cancer spreads, it's called metastatic cancer.

Valley fever has Symptom: Symptoms of coccidioidomycosis depend on the form of the infection. Valley fever is the first, also called acute, stage of coccidioidomycosis infection. This acute illness can become more serious. More serious illness includes long-term, called chronic, coccidioidomycosis and coccidioidomycosis that spreads, called disseminated coccidioidomycosis.

Valley fever has Cause: Breathing in spores of certain fungi causes valley fever. The fungi that cause valley fever are Coccidioides immitis and Coccidioides posadasii. They live in the soil in parts of Arizona, California, Nevada, Utah, New Mexico, Texas and Washington. The fungi also are in northern Mexico and Central and South America.
Valley fever has Risk Factor: Risk factors for valley fever include:
Valley fever has Complication: Complications of coccidioidomycosis may include:
Valley fever has Preventio: There is no vaccine to prevent valley fever.
Varicocele has Symptom: Pain.
Varicocele has Symptom: A mass in the scrotum.
Varicocele has Symptom: Differently sized testicles.
Varicocele has Symptom: Infertility.

Varicocele has Cause: The testicles receive oxygen-rich blood from two testicular arteries — one artery for each side of the scrotum. Similarly, there are also two testicular veins that transport oxygen-depleted blood back toward the heart. Within each side of the scrotum, a network of small veins (pampiniform plexus) transport the oxygen-depleted blood from the testicle to the main testicular vein. A varicocele is the enlargement of the pampiniform plexus.
Varicocele has Risk Factor: There don't appear to be any significant risk factors for developing a varicocele.
Varicocele has Complication: Poor testicular health.
Varicocele has Complication: Infertility.
Varicose veins has Symptom: Veins that are dark purple, blue or the same color as the skin. Depending on skin color, these changes may be harder or easier to see.
Varicose veins has Symptom: Veins that look twisted and bulging. They often look like cords on the legs.

Varicose veins has Cause: Weak or damaged valves can lead to varicose veins. Arteries carry blood from the heart to the rest of the body. Veins return blood from the rest of the body to the heart. To return blood to the heart, the veins in the legs must work against gravity.
Varicose veins has Risk Factor: Family history.
Varicose veins has Risk Factor: Obesity.
Varicose veins has Complication: Ulcers.
Varicose veins has Complication: Blood clots.
Varicose veins has Complication: Bleeding.
Varicose veins has Complication: Leg swelling.
Varicose veins has Preventio: Don't wear high heels or tight stockings, other than compression stockings.
Varicose veins has Preventio: Change how you sit or stand often.
Varicose veins has Preventio: Eat a high-fiber, low-salt diet.
Varicose veins has Preventio: Exercise.
Varicose veins has Preventio: Raise your legs when sitting or lying down.
Varicose veins has Preventio: Keep a healthy weight.

Vascular cognitive impairment and vascular dementia has Symptom: Vascular cognitive impairment symptoms vary depending on which area of the brain isn't getting enough blood flow. Symptoms often overlap with those of other types of dementia, especially Alzheimer's disease. In contrast to Alzheimer's, early symptoms of vascular cognitive impairment tend to affect the speed of thinking and problem-solving rather than memory loss.

Vascular cognitive impairment and vascular dementia has Cause: Vascular cognitive impairment and vascular dementia result from conditions that damage the brain's blood vessels. When blood vessels in the brain are damaged, they're not able to supply the brain with enough nutrition and oxygen. This affects a person's thought processes.

Vascular cognitive impairment and vascular dementia has Risk Factor: In general, the risk factors for vascular cognitive impairment are the same as those for heart disease and stroke. Risk factors for vascular cognitive impairment include:

Vascular cognitive impairment and vascular dementia has Preventio: The health of your brain's blood vessels is closely linked to your overall heart health. Taking these steps to keep your heart healthy also may help lower your risk of vascular cognitive impairment:
Vasculitis has Symptom: Fever.
Vasculitis has Symptom: Headache.
Vasculitis has Symptom: Tiredness.
Vasculitis has Symptom: Weight loss.
Vasculitis has Symptom: Aches and pains.
Vasculitis has Cause: Infections, such as hepatitis B and hepatitis C.
Vasculitis has Cause: Blood cancers.
Vasculitis has Cause: Immune system diseases, such as rheumatoid arthritis, lupus and scleroderma.
Vasculitis has Cause: Reactions to certain medicines.
Vasculitis has Risk Factor: Giant cell arteritis is rare before the age of 50. Kawasaki disease is most common in children younger than 5 years old.
Vasculitis has Risk Factor: Family history.
Vasculitis has Risk Factor: Lifestyle choices.
Vasculitis has Risk Factor: Medicines.
Vasculitis has Risk Factor: Infections.
Vasculitis has Risk Factor: Immune conditions.
Vasculitis has Risk Factor: Giant cell arteritis is much more common in people assigned female at birth. Buerger disease is more common in people assigned male at birth.
Vasculitis has Complication: Organ damage.
Vasculitis has Complication: Blood clots and aneurysms.
Vasculitis has Complication: Vision loss or blindness.
Vasculitis has Complication: Infections.
Vasovagal syncope has Symptom: Change in skin color.
Vasovagal syncope has Symptom: Lightheadedness.
Vasovagal syncope has Symptom: Tunnel vision — your field of vision narrows so that you see only what's in front of you.
Vasovagal syncope has Symptom: Upset stomach.
Vasovagal syncope has Symptom: Feeling warm.
Vasovagal syncope has Symptom: A cold, clammy sweat.
Vasovagal syncope has Symptom: Blurred vision.
Vasovagal syncope has Cause: Standing for long periods of time.
Vasovagal syncope has Cause: Heat exposure.
Vasovagal syncope has Cause: Seeing blood.
Vasovagal syncope has Cause: Having blood drawn.
Vasovagal syncope has Cause: Fear of bodily injury.
Vasovagal syncope has Cause: Straining, such as to pass stool.
Vasovagal syncope has Risk Factor: Children and young adults, although vasovagal syncope can happen at any age.
Vasovagal syncope has Risk Factor: People who stand for long periods of time.

Vasovagal syncope has Preventio: You may not always be able to avoid a vasovagal syncope episode. If you feel like you might faint, lie down and lift your legs. This allows gravity to keep blood flowing to your brain. If you can't lie down, sit down and put your head between your knees until you feel better.
Ventricular fibrillation has Symptom: Collapse and loss of consciousness are the most common symptoms of ventricular fibrillation.
Ventricular fibrillation has Cause: Ventricular fibrillation is caused by either:
Ventricular fibrillation has Risk Factor: Things that may increase the risk of ventricular fibrillation include:

Ventricular fibrillation has Complication: Without immediate treatment, ventricular fibrillation can cause death within minutes. The condition's rapid, erratic heartbeats cause the heart to abruptly stop pumping blood to the body. Blood pressure drops suddenly and significantly. The longer the body lacks blood, the greater the risk of damage to the brain and other organs.
Ventricular septal defect (VSD) has Symptom: Symptoms of serious heart problems present at birth (congenital heart defects) often appear during the first few days, weeks or months of a child's life.

Ventricular septal defect (VSD) has Cause: Ventricular septal defect (VSD) occurs as the baby's heart is developing during pregnancy. The muscular wall separating the heart into left and right sides doesn't form fully, leaving one or more holes. The size of the hole or holes can vary.
Ventricular septal defect (VSD) has Risk Factor: Risk factors for ventricular septal defect include:

Ventricular septal defect (VSD) has Complication: A small ventricular septal defect (VSD) may never cause any problems. Some medium or large VSD may be life-threatening. Treatment can help prevent many complications.

Ventricular septal defect (VSD) has Preventio: Because the cause is unclear, it may not be possible to prevent ventricular septal defect (VSD). But getting good prenatal care is important. If you have a VSD and are planning to become pregnant, schedule a visit with your health care provider and follow these steps:
Ventricular tachycardia has Symptom: Chest pain, called angina.
Ventricular tachycardia has Symptom: Dizziness.
Ventricular tachycardia has Symptom: Pounding heartbeat, called palpitations.
Ventricular tachycardia has Symptom: Lightheadedness.
Ventricular tachycardia has Symptom: Shortness of breath.
Ventricular tachycardia has Cause: Prior heart attack.
Ventricular tachycardia has Cause: Any heart condition that caused scarring of heart tissue, called structural heart disease.
Ventricular tachycardia has Cause: Poor blood flow to the heart muscle due to coronary artery disease.
Ventricular tachycardia has Cause: Heart problems present at birth, including long QT syndrome.
Ventricular tachycardia has Cause: Changes in levels of body minerals called electrolytes. These include potassium, sodium, calcium and magnesium.
Ventricular tachycardia has Cause: Side effects of medicines.
Ventricular tachycardia has Cause: Use of stimulants such as cocaine or methamphetamine.

Ventricular tachycardia has Risk Factor: Side effects of medicines.
Ventricular tachycardia has Risk Factor: Severe changes in the level of body minerals, called electrolyte imbalances.
Ventricular tachycardia has Risk Factor: A history of using stimulant drugs such as cocaine or methamphetamine.
Ventricular tachycardia has Complication: How fast the heart is beating.
Ventricular tachycardia has Complication: How long the rapid heart rate lasts.
Ventricular tachycardia has Complication: Whether there are other heart conditions.
Ventricular tachycardia has Preventio: Eat a balanced, nutritious diet.
Ventricular tachycardia has Preventio: Get regular exercise.
Ventricular tachycardia has Preventio: Maintain a healthy weight.
Ventricular tachycardia has Preventio: Control blood pressure and cholesterol.
Ventricular tachycardia has Preventio: Manage stress.
Ventricular tachycardia has Preventio: Limit alcohol.
Ventricular tachycardia has Preventio: Stop smoking.
Ventricular tachycardia has Preventio: Practice good sleep habits.
Vertebral tumor has Symptom: Back pain in the area of the tumor.
Vertebral tumor has Symptom: Back pain that radiates or shoots from the back to a nearby area.
Vertebral tumor has Symptom: Back pain that's worse at night.
Vertebral tumor has Symptom: Changes in sensation, such as numbness or a feeling of pins and needles.
Vertebral tumor has Symptom: Loss of the ability to move part of the body.
Vertebral tumor has Symptom: Loss of control over the bladder and bowels.
Vertebral tumor has Symptom: Muscle weakness.
Vertebral tumor has Cause: Hemangioma.
Vertebral tumor has Cause: Osteoid osteoma.
Vertebral tumor has Cause: Osteoblastoma.
Vertebral tumor has Cause: Aneurysmal bone cyst.
Vertebral tumor has Cause: Osteochondroma.
Vertebral tumor has Cause: Enchondroma.
Vertebral tumor has Cause: Chondroblastoma.

Vertebral tumor has Risk Factor: The risk of vertebral tumors is higher in people who have cancer or have been treated for cancer. Most vertebral tumors are caused by cancer that starts somewhere else in the body and spreads to the spine. Cancer that spreads to the spine most often starts in the breasts, lungs or prostate.
Vertebral tumor has Complication: Spinal cord compression.
Vertebral tumor has Complication: Spinal instability.
Vesicoureteral reflux has Symptom: A strong, constant urge to urinate.
Vesicoureteral reflux has Symptom: A burning feeling when urinating.
Vesicoureteral reflux has Symptom: The need to pass small amounts of urine often.
Vesicoureteral reflux has Symptom: Cloudy urine.
Vesicoureteral reflux has Symptom: Fever.
Vesicoureteral reflux has Symptom: Pain in the side, groin or stomach area.
