Vesicoureteral reflux has Cause: Secondary vesicoureteral reflux.
Vesicoureteral reflux has Risk Factor: Bladder and bowel dysfunction (BBD).
Vesicoureteral reflux has Risk Factor: Race.

Vesicoureteral reflux has Risk Factor: In general, girls have a much higher risk of having this condition than boys do. The exception is for vesicoureteral reflux that's present at birth. This is more common in boys.
Vesicoureteral reflux has Risk Factor: Infants and children up to age 2 are more likely to have vesicoureteral reflux than older children are.
Vesicoureteral reflux has Risk Factor: Family history.
Vesicoureteral reflux has Complication: Kidney scarring.
Vesicoureteral reflux has Complication: High blood pressure.
Vesicoureteral reflux has Complication: Kidney problems.
VEXAS syndrome has Symptom: Fever that keeps coming back.
VEXAS syndrome has Symptom: Tiredness.
VEXAS syndrome has Symptom: Painful skin rashes.
VEXAS syndrome has Symptom: Eye redness and irritation.
VEXAS syndrome has Symptom: Joint pain and swelling.
VEXAS syndrome has Symptom: Swelling and irritation of one or both testicles, also called orchitis.
VEXAS syndrome has Symptom: Swelling and irritation of the cartilage in the nose and ears, also called chondritis.
VEXAS syndrome has Symptom: Coughing and shortness of breath.
VEXAS syndrome has Symptom: Blood clots.

VEXAS syndrome has Cause: The cause of VEXAS syndrome is a changed gene that happens after you're born. The changed gene is called a UBA1 mutation. Experts don't know the cause of this change. The gene doesn't pass through families, called hereditary. So people with the changed gene don't get it from their parents or pass it to their children.

VEXAS syndrome has Risk Factor: The changed gene that causes VEXAS syndrome happens on the X chromosome. People assigned male at birth have only one X chromosome. So a change in this gene affects more people assigned male at birth than it does people assigned female at birth, who have two X chromosomes.As a result, people assigned male at birth are more likely to have VEXAS syndrome than are people assigned female at birth.
VEXAS syndrome has Risk Factor: Most people diagnosed with VEXAS syndrome are older than 50.
VEXAS syndrome has Complication: Infections.
VEXAS syndrome has Complication: Blood clots.
VEXAS syndrome has Complication: Myelodysplastic syndromes.
VEXAS syndrome has Complication: Bone marrow failure.

Viral gastroenteritis (stomach flu) has Symptom: Although it's commonly called stomach flu, gastroenteritis isn't the same as influenza. The flu (influenza) affects only your respiratory system — your nose, throat and lungs. Gastroenteritis, on the other hand, attacks your intestines, causing signs and symptoms such as:

Viral gastroenteritis (stomach flu) has Cause: You're most likely to get viral gastroenteritis when you eat or drink contaminated food or water. You may also be likely to get gastroenteritis if you share utensils, towels or food with someone who has one of the viruses that cause the condition.
Viral gastroenteritis (stomach flu) has Risk Factor: Gastroenteritis occurs all over the world and can affect people of all ages.

Viral gastroenteritis (stomach flu) has Complication: The main complication of viral gastroenteritis is dehydration — a severe loss of water and essential salts and minerals. If you're healthy and drink enough to replace fluids you lose from vomiting and diarrhea, dehydration shouldn't be a problem.
Viral gastroenteritis (stomach flu) has Preventio: The best way to prevent the spread of intestinal infections is to follow these precautions:
Viral hemorrhagic fevers has Symptom: Fever.
Viral hemorrhagic fevers has Symptom: Tiredness, weakness or feeling unwell.
Viral hemorrhagic fevers has Symptom: Muscle, bone or joint aches.
Viral hemorrhagic fevers has Symptom: Nausea and vomiting.
Viral hemorrhagic fevers has Symptom: Diarrhea.

Viral hemorrhagic fevers has Cause: Viral hemorrhagic fevers are spread by contact with infected animals. The viruses that cause viral hemorrhagic fevers live in many animal hosts. Most often, the hosts include mosquitoes, ticks, rodents, nonhuman primates or bats.
Viral hemorrhagic fevers has Risk Factor: Working with infected people.
Viral hemorrhagic fevers has Risk Factor: Killing or eating infected animals.
Viral hemorrhagic fevers has Risk Factor: Having unprotected sex with an infected person.
Viral hemorrhagic fevers has Risk Factor: Working outdoors or in rat-infested buildings.
Viral hemorrhagic fevers has Risk Factor: Being around infected blood or other body fluids.
Viral hemorrhagic fevers has Complication: Septic shock.
Viral hemorrhagic fevers has Complication: Failure in more than one organ.
Viral hemorrhagic fevers has Complication: Death.

Viral hemorrhagic fevers has Preventio: It can be hard to prevent viral hemorrhagic fevers. If you live in, work in or travel to areas where these diseases are common, use protective barriers when working with blood or body fluids. For instance, wear gloves, gowns, eye masks and face shields. Also take care working with lab specimens and waste.

Vitamin deficiency anemia has Symptom: Vitamin B-12 deficiency anemia most often begins slowly over months to years. You may not notice symptoms at first. But symptoms most often get worse as the deficiency worsens. Folate deficiency symptoms can start within weeks.

Vitamin deficiency anemia has Cause: Vitamin deficiency anemia can happen from not eating enough foods that have vitamin B-12 and folate, or from the body having trouble taking in and using these vitamins.
Vitamin deficiency anemia has Risk Factor: The following may increase the risk of vitamin deficiency anemia:
Vitamin deficiency anemia has Complication: Not having enough vitamin B-12 or folate raises the risk of many health concerns, including:
Vitamin deficiency anemia has Preventio: You can prevent some forms of vitamin deficiency anemia by choosing a healthy diet that includes a wide range of foods.
Vitiligo has Symptom: Vitiligo signs include:

Vitiligo has Cause: Vitiligo occurs when pigment-producing cells (melanocytes) die or stop producing melanin — the pigment that gives your skin, hair and eyes color. The involved patches of skin become lighter or white. It's unclear exactly what causes these pigment cells to fail or die. It may be related to:
Vitiligo has Risk Factor: Anyone can develop vitiligo. But you may be more likely to develop it if you:
Vitiligo has Complication: People with vitiligo may be at increased risk of:
Vocal cord paralysis has Symptom: A breathy quality to the voice.
Vocal cord paralysis has Symptom: Hoarseness.
Vocal cord paralysis has Symptom: Noisy breathing.
Vocal cord paralysis has Symptom: Shortness of breath.
Vocal cord paralysis has Symptom: Loss of vocal pitch.
Vocal cord paralysis has Symptom: Choking or coughing while swallowing food, drink or saliva.
Vocal cord paralysis has Symptom: The need to take several breaths while speaking.
Vocal cord paralysis has Symptom: Inability to speak loudly.
Vocal cord paralysis has Symptom: Loss of a gag reflex.
Vocal cord paralysis has Symptom: Ineffective coughing.
Vocal cord paralysis has Symptom: Frequent throat clearing.
Vocal cord paralysis has Cause: Injury to the vocal cord during surgery.
Vocal cord paralysis has Cause: Neck or chest injury.
Vocal cord paralysis has Cause: Stroke.
Vocal cord paralysis has Cause: Tumors.
Vocal cord paralysis has Cause: Infections.
Vocal cord paralysis has Cause: Neurological conditions.
Vocal cord paralysis has Risk Factor: Having throat or chest surgery.
Vocal cord paralysis has Risk Factor: Having a neurological condition.

Vocal cord paralysis has Complication: Breathing problems associated with vocal cord paralysis may be so mild that you just have a hoarse-sounding voice. Or they can be so serious that they're life-threatening.
Voice disorders has Cause: Laryngitis
Voice disorders has Cause: Voice changes related to the brain and nervous system, known as spasmodic dysphonia (spaz-MOD-ki dis-FOE-nee-uh)
Voice disorders has Cause: Polyps, nodules or cysts on the vocal cords — growths that aren't cancer
Voice disorders has Cause: Precancerous and cancerous growths
Voice disorders has Cause: Vocal cord paralysis or weakness

Von Willebrand disease has Symptom: The most common symptom of von Willebrand disease is bleeding more than expected.

Von Willebrand disease has Cause: The usual cause of von Willebrand disease is a changed gene passed through families. Conditions that happen in this way are called inherited. The gene manages von Willebrand factor, a protein needed for blood clotting.
Von Willebrand disease has Risk Factor: The main risk factor for von Willebrand disease is having a family history of it. Parents pass down the gene that causes the condition to their children.
Von Willebrand disease has Complication: Rarely, von Willebrand disease can cause bleeding that won't stop. This can be life-threatening. Other complications of von Willebrand disease can include:

Von Willebrand disease has Preventio: If you plan to have children and have a family history of von Willebrand disease, think about getting genetic counseling. If you carry the gene for von Willebrand disease, you can pass it down to your children even if you don't have symptoms.
Vulvar cancer has Symptom: A lump, wartlike bump or an open sore on the vulva.
Vulvar cancer has Symptom: Bleeding in the genital area that isn't from menstruation.
Vulvar cancer has Symptom: Itching of the skin of the vulva that doesn't go away.
Vulvar cancer has Symptom: Pain and tenderness that affects the vulva.
Vulvar cancer has Symptom: Skin changes, such as changes in the color of the skin of the vulva or thickening of the skin.
Vulvar cancer has Cause: It's not always clear what causes vulvar cancer. This cancer starts on the area of skin that surrounds the urethra and vagina. This area of skin is called the vulva.
Vulvar cancer has Risk Factor: The risk of vulvar cancer increases with age, though it can happen at any age. The average age at diagnosis is 65.
Vulvar cancer has Risk Factor: Being exposed to human papillomavirus.
Vulvar cancer has Risk Factor: Smoking tobacco.
Vulvar cancer has Risk Factor: Having a weakened immune system.
Vulvar cancer has Risk Factor: Having a history of a precancerous condition of the vulva.
Vulvar cancer has Risk Factor: Having a skin condition involving the vulva.

Vulvar cancer has Preventio: To lower the risk of vulvar cancer, don't smoke tobacco. Take steps to protect yourself from human papillomavirus infection. Human papillomavirus, also called HPV, is associated with the most common type of vulvar cancer.
Vulvodynia has Symptom: Burning.
Vulvodynia has Symptom: Irritation.
Vulvodynia has Symptom: Stinging.
Vulvodynia has Symptom: Rawness.
Vulvodynia has Symptom: Soreness.
Vulvodynia has Symptom: Sharp or knife-like pain.
Vulvodynia has Cause: Injury to or irritation of the nerves of the vulva.
Vulvodynia has Cause: Past infections of the vagina.
Vulvodynia has Cause: Painful swelling called inflammation that affects the vulva.
Vulvodynia has Cause: Some genetic conditions.
Vulvodynia has Cause: Allergies.
Vulvodynia has Cause: Hormonal changes.
Vulvodynia has Cause: Muscle spasm or weakness in the pelvic floor, which supports the uterus, bladder and bowel.
Vulvodynia has Complication: Without treatment, vulvodynia can affect mental health, relationships and other aspects of your life.
Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia has Symptom: Fatigue.
Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia has Symptom: Fever.
Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia has Symptom: Weight loss.
Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia has Symptom: Night sweats.
Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia has Symptom: Numbness in the hands or feet.
Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia has Symptom: Swollen lymph nodes.
Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia has Symptom: A feeling of pain or fullness under the ribs on your left side, which may be caused by an enlarged spleen.
Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia has Symptom: Easy bruising.
Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia has Symptom: Bleeding nose or gums.
Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia has Symptom: Headache.
Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia has Symptom: Shortness of breath.
Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia has Symptom: Changes in vision.
Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia has Symptom: Confusion.

Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia has Cause: Cancer happens when cells develop changes in their DNA. A cell's DNA holds the instructions that tell a cell what to do. The changes tell the cells to multiply quickly. The cells continue living when healthy cells would die as part of their natural lifecycle.
Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia has Risk Factor: Being older.
Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia has Risk Factor: Being male.
Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia has Risk Factor: Being white.
Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia has Risk Factor: Having a family history of lymphoma.
Wet macular degeneration has Symptom: Visual distortions, such as straight lines that seem to be bent.
Wet macular degeneration has Symptom: Reduced central vision in one or both eyes.
Wet macular degeneration has Symptom: The need for brighter light when reading or doing close-up work.
Wet macular degeneration has Symptom: Difficulty adjusting to low light levels, such as when entering a dimly lit restaurant or theater.
Wet macular degeneration has Symptom: Increased blurriness of printed words.
Wet macular degeneration has Symptom: Difficulty recognizing faces.
Wet macular degeneration has Symptom: A well-defined blurry spot or blind spot in the field of vision.
Wet macular degeneration has Cause: Vision loss caused by irregular blood vessel growth.
Wet macular degeneration has Cause: Vision loss caused by fluid buildup in the back of the eye.
Wet macular degeneration has Risk Factor: This disease is most common in people over 50.
Wet macular degeneration has Risk Factor: Family history and genetics.
Wet macular degeneration has Risk Factor: Race.
Wet macular degeneration has Risk Factor: Smoking.
Wet macular degeneration has Risk Factor: Obesity.
Wet macular degeneration has Risk Factor: Cardiovascular disease.

Wet macular degeneration has Complication: People whose wet macular degeneration has progressed to central vision loss have a higher risk of depression and social isolation. With profound loss of vision, people may see visual hallucinations. This condition is known as Charles Bonnet syndrome.
Wet macular degeneration has Preventio: Manage all other medical conditions.
Wet macular degeneration has Preventio: Don't smoke.
Wet macular degeneration has Preventio: Maintain a healthy weight and exercise regularly.
Wet macular degeneration has Preventio: Choose a diet rich in fruits and vegetables.
Wet macular degeneration has Preventio: Include fish in your diet.
Wheat allergy has Symptom: A child or an adult with wheat allergy is likely to develop symptoms within minutes to hours after eating something containing wheat. Wheat allergy symptoms include:

Wheat allergy has Cause: If you have wheat allergy, exposure to a wheat protein primes your immune system for an allergic reaction. You can develop an allergy to any of the four classes of wheat proteins: albumin, globulin, gliadin and gluten.
Wheat allergy has Risk Factor: Certain factors may put you at greater risk of developing wheat allergy:
Whiplash has Symptom: Neck pain and stiffness.
Whiplash has Symptom: Pain that gets worse with neck movement.
Whiplash has Symptom: Loss of range of motion in the neck.
Whiplash has Symptom: Headaches, most often starting at the base of the skull.
Whiplash has Symptom: Tenderness or pain in the shoulder, upper back or arms.
Whiplash has Symptom: Tingling or numbness in the arms.
Whiplash has Symptom: Tiredness.
Whiplash has Symptom: Dizziness.

Whiplash has Cause: Whiplash most often occurs when the head is quickly thrown backward and then forward with force. This often happens as a result of a rear-end car crash. This motion can cause damage to the muscles and tissues of the neck.
Whiplash has Risk Factor: Rear-end car crash.
Whiplash has Risk Factor: Physical abuse or assault.
Whiplash has Risk Factor: Contact sports.
Whiplash has Complication: Severe neck pain.
Whiplash has Complication: More-limited range of motion.
Whiplash has Complication: Pain that spread to the arms.
Whipple's disease has Symptom: Digestive signs and symptoms are common in Whipple disease and may include:

Whipple's disease has Cause: Whipple disease is caused by a type of bacterium called Tropheryma whipplei. The bacteria affect the mucosal lining of your small intestine first, forming small sores (lesions) within the wall of the intestine. The bacteria also damage the fine, hairlike projections (villi) that line the small intestine.

Whipple's disease has Risk Factor: Because so little is known about the bacteria that cause Whipple disease, risk factors for the disease haven't been clearly identified. Based on available reports, it appears more likely to affect:

Whipple's disease has Complication: The lining of your small intestine has fine, hairlike projections (villi) that help your body absorb nutrients. Whipple disease damages the villi, impairing nutrient absorption. Nutritional deficiencies are common in people with Whipple disease and can lead to fatigue, weakness, weight loss and joint pain.

Whooping cough has Symptom: Once you become infected with whooping cough, it takes about 5 to 10 days for symptoms to start. Sometimes it takes up to three weeks. The symptoms often are mild at first. They may seem like those of a common cold. They can include:

Whooping cough has Cause: A type of bacteria called Bordetella pertussis causes whooping cough. When an infected person coughs or sneezes, tiny germ-filled droplets spray into the air. Anyone who happens to be nearby can breathe in the droplets. The bacteria that cause whooping cough also can spread when people are together for a long time. Or these germs can spread when people share breathing space, such as while holding a newborn on your chest.

Whooping cough has Risk Factor: The whooping cough vaccine you receive as a child wears off over time. This leaves many teenagers and adults prone to the infection during an outbreak. And regular outbreaks still happen.
Whooping cough has Complication: Teens and adults often recover from whooping cough with no problems. When other health conditions happen, they tend to be side effects of intense coughing, such as:

Whooping cough has Preventio: The best way to prevent whooping cough is with the pertussis vaccine. It's often given together with vaccines against two other serious diseases: diphtheria and tetanus. Healthcare professionals recommend starting vaccination during infancy.
Wilms tumor has Symptom: A mass in the stomach area that can be felt.
Wilms tumor has Symptom: Swelling in the stomach area.
Wilms tumor has Symptom: Pain in the stomach area.
Wilms tumor has Cause: It's not clear what causes Wilms tumor.
Wilms tumor has Risk Factor: Being Black.
Wilms tumor has Risk Factor: Having a family history of Wilms tumor.
Wilms tumor has Preventio: Wilms tumor can't be prevented.
Wilson's disease has Symptom: Tiredness and loss of appetite.
Wilson's disease has Symptom: A yellowing of the skin and the whites of the eye, known as jaundice.
Wilson's disease has Symptom: Golden-brown or copper-colored rings around the irises of the eyes, known as Kayser-Fleischer rings.
Wilson's disease has Symptom: Fluid buildup in the legs or stomach area.
Wilson's disease has Symptom: Problems with speech, swallowing or physical coordination.
Wilson's disease has Symptom: Depression, mood changes and personality changes.
Wilson's disease has Symptom: Having a hard time falling asleep and staying asleep.
Wilson's disease has Symptom: Uncontrolled movements or muscle stiffness.

Wilson's disease has Cause: Wilson's disease is caused by a changed gene passed down from each parent. If you get only one affected gene, you won't get the disease yourself, but you'll be a carrier. This means you could pass the affected gene to your children.

Wilson's disease has Risk Factor: You can be at greater risk of Wilson's disease if your parents or siblings have the condition. Ask your doctor whether you should have genetic testing to find out if you have Wilson's disease. Diagnosing the condition as early as possible greatly increases the chances of successful treatment.
Wilson's disease has Complication: Scarring of the liver, also known as cirrhosis.
Wilson's disease has Complication: Liver failure.
Wilson's disease has Complication: Lasting nervous system issues.
Wilson's disease has Complication: Kidney problems.
Wilson's disease has Complication: Mental health issues.
Wilson's disease has Complication: Blood problems.
Wolff-Parkinson-White (WPW) syndrome has Symptom: Rapid, fluttering or pounding heartbeats.
Wolff-Parkinson-White (WPW) syndrome has Symptom: Chest pain.
Wolff-Parkinson-White (WPW) syndrome has Symptom: Difficulty breathing.
Wolff-Parkinson-White (WPW) syndrome has Symptom: Dizziness or lightheadedness.
Wolff-Parkinson-White (WPW) syndrome has Symptom: Fainting.
Wolff-Parkinson-White (WPW) syndrome has Symptom: Fatigue.
Wolff-Parkinson-White (WPW) syndrome has Symptom: Shortness of breath.
Wolff-Parkinson-White (WPW) syndrome has Symptom: Anxiety.
Wolff-Parkinson-White (WPW) syndrome has Cause: The two upper chambers are called the atria.
Wolff-Parkinson-White (WPW) syndrome has Cause: The two lower chambers are called the ventricles.
Wolff-Parkinson-White (WPW) syndrome has Complication: WPWsyndrome has been linked to sudden cardiac death in children and young adults.
Wrinkles has Symptom: Wrinkles are the lines and creases that form in your skin. Some wrinkles become deep and may be especially noticeable around the eyes, mouth and neck.
Wrinkles has Cause: Age.
Wrinkles has Cause: Ultraviolet (UV) radiation.
Wrinkles has Cause: Smoking and pollution.
Wrinkles has Cause: Repeated facial expressions.
Wrinkles has Cause: Family history.
Wrinkles has Preventio: Protect your skin fromUVradiation.
Wrinkles has Preventio: Wash your face and moisturize.
Wrinkles has Preventio: Don't smoke.
Wrinkles has Preventio: Eat a healthy diet.

Wrist pain has Symptom: Wrist pain may vary, depending on the cause. For example, osteoarthritis pain often is described as being similar to a dull toothache. Carpal tunnel syndrome usually causes a pins and needles feeling. This tingling sensation often occurs in the thumb and index and middle fingers, especially at night. The precise location of wrist pain also provides clues to what's behind the symptoms.
Wrist pain has Cause: Damage to any of the parts of your wrist can cause pain and affect your ability to use your wrist and hand. The damage may result from:
Wrist pain has Risk Factor: Sports participation.
Wrist pain has Risk Factor: Repetitive work.
Wrist pain has Risk Factor: Certain diseases or conditions.
Wrist pain has Preventio: Build bone strength.
Wrist pain has Preventio: Prevent falls.
Wrist pain has Preventio: Use protective gear for athletic activities.
Wrist pain has Preventio: Pay attention to ergonomics.
X-linked agammaglobulinemia has Symptom: Very small tonsils.
X-linked agammaglobulinemia has Symptom: Small or no lymph nodes.

X-linked agammaglobulinemia has Cause: X-linked agammaglobulinemia is caused by a change in a gene. People with the condition can't produce proteins called antibodies that fight infection. About 40% of people with the condition have a family member who has it.
X-linked agammaglobulinemia has Complication: Long-lasting, called chronic, lung disease.
X-linked agammaglobulinemia has Complication: Increased risk of certain cancers.
X-linked agammaglobulinemia has Complication: Infectious arthritis.
X-linked agammaglobulinemia has Complication: Increased risk of central nervous system infections from live vaccines.
Yeast infection (vaginal) has Symptom: Itching and irritation in the vagina and tissues at the vaginal opening, called the vulva.
Yeast infection (vaginal) has Symptom: A burning feeling, mainly during intercourse or while urinating.
Yeast infection (vaginal) has Symptom: Redness and swelling of the vulva. Redness may be harder to see on Black or brown skin than on white skin.
Yeast infection (vaginal) has Symptom: Vaginal pain and soreness.
Yeast infection (vaginal) has Symptom: Thick, white vaginal shedding of fluid and cells, called discharge, with little or no odor. The discharge looks like cottage cheese.
Yeast infection (vaginal) has Cause: Antibiotic use.
Yeast infection (vaginal) has Cause: Pregnancy.
Yeast infection (vaginal) has Cause: Diabetes that isn't well-managed.
Yeast infection (vaginal) has Cause: A weakened immune system.
Yeast infection (vaginal) has Cause: Use of birth control pills or hormone therapy that raises levels of the hormone estrogen.
Yeast infection (vaginal) has Risk Factor: Antibiotic use.
Yeast infection (vaginal) has Risk Factor: Raised estrogen levels.
Yeast infection (vaginal) has Risk Factor: People with poorly managed blood sugar are at greater risk of yeast infections than are people with well-managed blood sugar.
Yeast infection (vaginal) has Risk Factor: Weakened immune system.
Yeast infection (vaginal) has Preventio: Do not wear tight pantyhose, underwear or jeans.
Yeast infection (vaginal) has Preventio: Do not douche. This removes some of the good germs in the vagina that protect from infection.
Yeast infection (vaginal) has Preventio: Do not use scented products in the vaginal area. For instance, don't use scented bubble bath, soap, menstrual pads and tampons.
Yeast infection (vaginal) has Preventio: Do not use hot tubs or take hot baths.
Yeast infection (vaginal) has Preventio: Do not use antibiotics you don't need. For instance, don't take antibiotics for colds or other viral infections.
Yeast infection (vaginal) has Preventio: Do not stay in wet clothes, such as swimsuits and workout clothes, for longer than needed.
Yips has Symptom: The most common symptom associated with the yips is an involuntary muscle jerk, although some people experience tremors, twitches, spasms or freezing.

Yips has Cause: In some people, the yips are a type of focal dystonia, a condition that causes involuntary muscle contractions during a specific task. It's most likely related to overuse of a certain set of muscles, similar to writer's cramp. Anxiety worsens the effect.
Yips has Risk Factor: Older age.
Yips has Risk Factor: More experience playing golf.
Yips has Risk Factor: Tournament play.
Zenker's diverticulum has Symptom: Trouble swallowing, called dysphagia.
Zenker's diverticulum has Symptom: Burping.
Zenker's diverticulum has Symptom: A gurgling noise at the back of the throat.
Zenker's diverticulum has Symptom: Coughing.
Zenker's diverticulum has Symptom: Hoarseness.
Zenker's diverticulum has Symptom: Bad breath.
Zenker's diverticulum has Symptom: Choking.
Zenker's diverticulum has Cause: The cause of Zenker's diverticulum isn't known. It's not known why the walls of the esophagus change to form a bulge or pouch in the condition.
Zenker's diverticulum has Risk Factor: Being older than 60.
Zenker's diverticulum has Risk Factor: Being male.
Zenker's diverticulum has Risk Factor: Having gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) or a condition in which part of the stomach bulges into the chest, called a hiatal hernia.
Zenker's diverticulum has Risk Factor: Having spinal surgery.
Zenker's diverticulum has Complication: Lung infection.
Zenker's diverticulum has Complication: Weight loss and not getting enough nutrients, called malnutrition.
Zollinger-Ellison syndrome has Symptom: Stomach pain.
Zollinger-Ellison syndrome has Symptom: Diarrhea.
Zollinger-Ellison syndrome has Symptom: Burning, aching or discomfort in your upper belly.
Zollinger-Ellison syndrome has Symptom: Acid reflux and heartburn.
Zollinger-Ellison syndrome has Symptom: Burping.
Zollinger-Ellison syndrome has Symptom: Nausea and vomiting.
Zollinger-Ellison syndrome has Symptom: Bleeding in your digestive tract.
Zollinger-Ellison syndrome has Symptom: Losing weight without trying.
Zollinger-Ellison syndrome has Symptom: Loss of appetite.

Zollinger-Ellison syndrome has Cause: The exact cause of Zollinger-Ellison syndrome isn't known. But the pattern of events that occurs in Zollinger-Ellison syndrome typically follows the same sequence. The syndrome begins when one or more tumors form in the pancreas or a part of the small intestine called the duodenum. The duodenum is the section connected to the stomach. Sometimes the tumors form at other sites, such as the lymph nodes next to the pancreas.
Zollinger-Ellison syndrome has Risk Factor: If you have a first-degree relative, such as a sibling or parent, with MEN 1, it's more likely that you'll have Zollinger-Ellison syndrome.
